Description: Wild berry, underbrush, tilled earth, leather and blue flower aromas shape the nose of this fragrant, stunning red. The newest Taurasi addition to the firm's already impressive line up, this is focused, terroir-driven and loaded with finesse. It delivers flavors of juicy wild cherry, crushed rasperry, blood orange, star anise and tobacco, framed in lithe, polished tannins and fresh acidity. While already enjoyable, it will also age well for years. Drink through 2030.
Name: Mastroberardino 2015 Stilema  (Taurasi)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dense aromas of loamy soil, packed violets, black-currant jellies and a touch of prune show on the nose of this bottling of an obscure Italian grape. The palate is thick with stewed black-fruit flavors, framed by tense tannins, buoyant acidity, licorice spice and plenty of earthy grip.
Name: Bevela 2012 Matela Le Bon Climat Vineyard Teroldego (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer enchanting notes of red cherry, tar, raspberry, herb, cranberry, spice and herb. The palate dances softly, with a sense of freshness and brightness that heightens the interest. A mouthwatering finish with caramel notes caps it off.
Designation: Vineyard Series Art Den Hoed Vineyard Painted Hills
Name: Maryhill 2015 Vineyard Series Art Den Hoed Vineyard Painted Hills Dolcetto (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Thick on the nose, this impressive bottling starts with aromas of robust cherry, freshly cut pine wood and wild chaparral herbs. It's quite lavish on the palate, with soft, creamy tannins presenting flavors of Morello cherry and fennel bulb.
Name: Pelletiere 2016 Montepulciano (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: Made with rare native grape Pugnitello, this opens with subtle aromas of tobacco, French oak, blackberry and leather. Smooth and tight, the taut, austere palate offers dried cherry, oak-driven spice and crushed herb set against compact close-grained tannins that grip the close. Give it time several more years to unclench, then drink to capture the remaining fruit richness.
Name: San Felice 2015 Pugnitello (Toscana)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is intense in color and structure, feeling quite dry and firmly tannic, but countering that austerity with substantial blackberry flavors and a good sense of freshness. Enjoy it now with indulgent, rich foods or cellar to see how it mellows. Best after 2023.
Name: Starfield 2016 Aglianico (El Dorado)

Description: Made entirely with organically farmed Canaiolo grapes, this opens with aromas of red berry, hay and cooking spice. The savory palate offers raspberry jam, star anise and clove alongside chewy tannins.
Name: Tenuta Casabianca 2015 Loccareto Canaiolo (Toscana)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a bold, well-structured wine that combines fruity and savory notes like blackberries, mushrooms and beef juices for a concentrated, complex and rather tannic impression. It has a deep color with a brownish rim, cranberry aromas and a full, dry mouthfeel.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2016 Aglianico (Amador County)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a focused sharpness to the nose, with aromas of red currant, cranberry and underripe red plum melding with shades of green tobacco and purple flowers. This is tense and linear on the palate, offering flavors tart red berries and peppery spice riding on a roaring river of acidity. Medium-grained, gripping tannins frame it all.
Name: Rivera 2013 Puer Apuliae Riserva Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: Aromas of toast, mature blackberry, crushed herb and underbrush lead the nose. The lively, full-bodied palate offers dried cherry, prune, baking spice and licorice alongside assertive, drying tannins that clench the finish.
Name: Tenute Lunelli 2015 Tenuta Castelbuono Carapace Riserva  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Aromas of French oak, baked plum, blackberry jam, vanilla and a balsamic note form the nose along with a whiff of nail polish. Bold and densely concentrated, the palate offers mouthfuls of blackberry jam, dried cherry, mocha, oak-driven spice and a confectionary note. The tightly packed, close-gained tannins creep up on you and clench the finish along with the heat of alcohol.
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2007 Spinning Beauty  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Vibrant aromas of spiced cranberry and strawberry meld with accents of crushed black pepper and dried mentholated herbs. Firmly medium in weight, the palate is savory and racy yet well balanced by lingering flavors of juicy red cherry and tart currant. A taut line of acidity and firm tannins make this an easy choice for the dinner table.
Name: Tormaresca 2013 Masseria Maìme Negroamaro (Salento)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling of a grape from northern Italy shows aromas of black cherry, blackberry, loamy soil and roasted coffee. The mouthfeel is chalky and nearly sticky, with dark-fruit flavors lifted by wild thyme and sagebrush. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Pelletiere 2016 Estate Lagrein (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: Dense aromas of dark cherry coulis, cigar wrapper, leather and anise form a warming, inviting nose. There's richness on the palate in the form of ripe dark-skinned fruit, with more leather and tobacco meeting a slick of tangy granite. Drying, medium-grained tannins and pert acidity frame it all.
Name: Vespa 2014 Helena Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: There's good depth to the blackberry and cherry jam aromas on the nose, with levity coming from flecks of allspice and clove. The medium-bodied palate is rounded out by ripe berry flavors and honed by a tangy mineral slick. There's some grit to the tannins but ultimately this is reigned in by a wealth of fruit and acidity.
Name: Feudo Croce 2016 Aglianico (Salento)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright aromas of ripe cherry, blood orange and violet carry the nose of this playful red. The light-bodied palate is buoyant in red fruit flavors, with juicy acidity and a pleasing tannic grip.
Name: Rivera 2016 Violante Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: This is a juicy yet taut Negroamaro that's sourced from 20-year-old alberello-trained vines. A nose of leather and clove moves to a sour cherry-laden palate, with tangy granite and well-mannered yet pervasive tannins.
Name: Schola Sarmenti 2016 Roccamora Negroamaro (Nardò)

Description: This straighforward offering brings aromas of crushed strawberry and currant to the fore, with shades of fennel frond and tobacco leaf. It's light and tangy on the palate yet persistent in its juicy red-fruit flavor, with slicks of granite and cocoa-nib dusted tannins bringing savory appeal.
Name: Cantina Ariano 2015 Negroamaro (Puglia)

Description: Light aromas of red currant and cherry meld with flecks of peppery spice and tobacco on the nose. This is light and zesty in feel, with a dusting of tannins that prop up the crushed cranberry and currant flavors.
Name: Botromagno 2015 Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A mild concentration of strawberry and cherry preserves greats the nose, with bits of earth and red flowers in the background. This is a straightforward, juicy offering that is propped up by tangy acidity and soft tannins.
Name: Cantina di Ruvo 2013 Augustale Riserva Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: A wealth of frankincense and sweet spice carries over the red plum and cherry core. This is soft and supple on the palate, with proper balance of acidity and tannin to give it grip. Enjoy soon for its fruity, gentle approach.
Name: Schola Sarmenti 2016 Antièri Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: Sheens of mulling spice and cigar wrapper cover a core of raspberry and cherry aromas. The medium-bodied palate offers a dollop of tangy cranberry, with baking spice on the midpalate and coffee on the finish.
Name: Cantina di Ruvo 2016 Grifo Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: Aromas of smashed red plum and berries carry a sheen of hard cheese rind and milk chocolate on the nose. There's a sheen of sweet oak on the first sip, with a juicy red-berry flavor taking over on the midpalate. Bright acidity and sandy tannins remain a constant from start to finish.
Name: Apollonio 2012 Terragnolo Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Ripe aromas of strawberry and dark cherry kick off this easygoing red. It's fleshy and fruity on the palate, with a soft tannic texture and mild acidity.
Name: Rivera 2017 Negroamaro (Salento)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: With a color like cranberry juice and gritty aromas that are low on fruit and heavy on asphalt and leather, this is an off-beat varietal Montepulciano. A light lucid palate contains tart lean flavors of currant and pie cherry.
Name: Durigutti 2017 Proyecto Las Compuertas Cordisco (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Enticing mature dark berry, tobacco, forest floor and leather lead the nose. The concentrated, generous palate delivers blackberry jam, clove, star anise and ground pepper alongside polished, silky tannins. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Serpico Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Made entirely with native red grape Vespolina, this fragrant red opens with mouthwatering aromas of white pepper, ground clove, wild berry and violet. The aromas carry on to the savory palate together with crushed raspberry, strawberry and black pepper. A tangy saline note wraps up the finish while supple tannins lend elegant support.
Name: La Badina 2015 Vespolina (Coste della Sesia)

Description: This natural-leaning producer delivers once again, this time with a Sicilian variety from the up-and-coming Riverland region. This wine offers cran-raspberry fruit, drying leaves, earth, meat and drying herbs on the nose. The light- to medium-bodied palate brings more cranberry tang, with savory, sinewy tannins and an earthy core. This is a textural wine perfect for charcuterie or roast meats.
Name: Unico Zelo 2017 The River Nero d'Avola (Riverland)

Description: This wine is rustic and just a touch funky. Bright, crunchy red fruit, minerals and earth are bolstered by raspy, savory tannins and lively acidity. Somewhere between light and medium bodied, this is a restrained yet juicy-fruited table wine that's a joy to drink.
Name: Unico Zelo 2016 Cherry Fields Dolcetto (Clare Valley)

Description: This wine opens with alluring aromas of violet, dark berry, nutmeg and thyme. The vibrant palate offers black cherry, licorice and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016 Dal Re Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Aromas of woodland berry, dark spice and tilled soil lead the nose. The bright palate offers Marasca cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity.
Name: Guastaferro 2013 Memini Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Dark berry, Mediterranean scrub and tangerine zest aromas carry over the juicy palate along with sour cherry and star anise. Fresh acidity adds backup while firm tannins provide the framework. Drink 2019–2024.
Name: Villa Raiano 2016 Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Enticing aromas of violet, red berry and clove lead the nose while the vibrant palate offers raspberry jam, star anise and black pepper. Fine-grained tannins support the savory flavors.
Name: Antonio Caggiano 2015 Campi Taurasini Salae Domini Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, violet and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The vibrant palate offers crushed blackberry, licorice and clove alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016 Rubrato Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, tilled soil and smoke emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers black plum, black cherry jam, clove and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity.
Name: La Sibilla 2014 Vigna Madre Piedirosso (Campi Flegrei)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and dark spice lead the nose. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, black pepper and a touch of cocoa alongside polished tannins.
Name: Tempa di Zoè 2015 Zero Supercampano Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Aromas of pressed violet, red berry and underbrush lead the nose. The savory polished palate delivers raspberry, red cherry and cinnamon alongside velvety tannins and fresh acidity.
Name: Mastroberardino 2016 RediMore Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Aromas of ground pepper and ripe black-skinned berry follow over to the smooth juicy palate along with raspberry compote. Polished tannins provide the elegant framework. Drink through 2021.
Name: Pietro Cassina 2011 Vespolina (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Dark berry, leather and eucalyptus aromas come together in the glass. The savory palate offers raspberry jam, dried black cherry and a note of cocoa alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity.
Name: Terredora Di Paolo 2010 Il Principio Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark fruit, eucalyptus and leather. The juicy palate delivers black cherry jam, clove and black pepper. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity and fine-grained tannins.
Name: Terre Stregate 2015 Manent Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: This exciting young producer delivers another highly drinkable drop. It comes in the form of this palatable pasta wine, which oozes brambly blackberry fruit, tobacco, dried herbs, chocolate and coffee. The palate is silky smooth and medium bodied, with a soft line of tannins and a spicy, savory finish.
Name: Delinquente 2017 The Bullet Dodger Montepulciano (Riverland)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, tilled soil and dark fruit lead the nose. The juicy palate offers black cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2024.
Name: Antico Castello 2014 Magis Aglianico (Irpinia)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of black plum, tilled soil and cedar lead the nose. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, black pepper, cocoa and star anise alongside chewy tannins and the warmth of evident alcohol.
Name: Fontanavecchia 2010 Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe dark fruit, cocoa and cedar emerge from the glass. The densely knit palate delivers blackberry jam, mocha and licorice alongside velvety tannins and evident alcohol.
Name: Fontanavecchia 2011 Grave Mora Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of dark berry, blue flower and a whiff of charred earth lead the nose. The easygoing palate offers Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and Mediterranean herb alongside pliant tannins.
Name: Fontanavecchia 2013  Aglianico del Taburno

Description: This opens with aromas of dark berry, underbrush and leather. The savory palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2014 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This earthy red opens with aromas of leather, tilled soil, ripe black-skinned fruit and a whiff of barnyard. The aromas carry over to the juicy palate along with mature Marasca cherry, crushed black olive and dark spice. It has a rustic charm but it's also smooth and savory.
Name: Pala 2014 Essentija Bovale (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This Sardinian red offers aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, myrtle, new leather and scorched earth. The firm palate evokes dried black cherry, coconut, grilled sage, roasted coffee bean and clove alongside close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Argiolas 2015 Korem Bovale (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Description: Dark berry, espresso and cooking-spice aromas emerge from the glass. The savory ripe palate offers raspberry jam, raisin and vanilla alongside polished tannins.
Name: Montesole 2013 Sairus Aglianico (Irpinia)

Appellation: Monica di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Truffle, ripe blackberry and scorched earth aromas lift out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the medium-bodied easygoing palate along with mature black cherry, clove and Mediterranean brush. Lithe tannins provide soft support. Drink soon.
Name: Mora & Memo 2017 Ica  (Monica di Sardegna)

Description: Aromas of tobacco, leather and ripe dark fruit lead the nose. The firm palate offers prune, clove and coconut alongside a backbone of assertive close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Quintodecimo 2014 Terra d'Eclano Aglianico (Irpinia)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, leather and tilled soil. The juicy palate offers blackberry, clove and black pepper alongside polished tannins.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2015  Aglianico del Taburno

Description: Aromas of dark fruit, mocha and vanilla lead the nose. The firm palate offers raspberry jam, licorice and black pepper alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Montevetrano 2015 Core Aglianico (Campania)

Appellation: Monica di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Vinous aromas of wild berry practically jump out of the glass. Smooth and juicy, the polished, straightforward palate doles out succulent blackberry, Marasca cherry and a hint of clove alongside soft, round tannins. Drink now.
Name: Pala 2017 I Fiori  (Monica di Sardegna)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted oak, baked plum and vanilla lead the nose. The assertive palate offers black cherry jam, cake spice and espresso alongside grainy, rather astringent tannins.
Name: Cantina del Taburno 2015 Blue Apis  (Aglianico del Taburno)

Description: Ripe wild berry, spiced plum and Mediterranean brush aromas lead the nose. The juicy palate offers Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of orange zest alongside pliant tannins.
Name: Tenute Casoli 2016 Kataro Aglianico (Irpinia)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This 100% Pallagrello Nero opens with aromas of ripe black fruit, cooking spice and underbrush. The firm palate offers roasted coffee bean, vanilla and black plum alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: Vestini Campagnano 2015 Pallagrello Nero (Terre del Volturno)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, underbrush and cooking spice. The medium-bodied savory palate offers black-cherry jam, white pepper and a clove note alongside lithe tannins and fresh acidity.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2015 Sir V Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Blue-flower, tilled soil and dark-berry aromas lead the nose. The straightforward palate delivers ripe blackberry, black pepper and mocha alongside velvety tannins.
Name: Donnachiara 2016 Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, blue flower and a whiff of moist earth emerge from the glass. The easygoing palate offers blackberry jam and licorice alongside round tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Manimurci 2016 4 Contrade Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Made with rare native grape Cagnulari, this Sardinian red has aromas of wild black-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and dark culinary spice. The lively easygoing palate offers ripe blackberry, spiced blueberry, tangy blood orange and a hint of clove alongside pliant tannins.
Name: Santa Maria La Palma 2017 Cagnulari (Alghero)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of dark berry, espresso and tobacco lead the nose. The solid palate offers dried black cherry, roasted coffee bean and cooking spice alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: Cantina del Taburno 2015 Delius  (Aglianico del Taburno)

Description: Made entirely with native grape Piedirosso, this opens with aromas of red berry, cooking spice and a whiff of smoke. The savory palate delivers red plum, clove and white pepper alongside pliant tannins.
Name: Cantina del Taburno 2015 Piedirosso (Beneventano)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed Piedirosso, this has aromas of tilled earth, red berry and cooking spice. The juicy palate offers ripe raspberry, clove and a touch of hazelnut on the finish.
Name: Cantina del Vesuvio 2015 Rosso Piedirosso (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Description: This opens with dark berry and Mediterranean brush aromas. The juicy easygoing palate offers black cherry and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: D'Aione 2017 Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, dark berry and baking spice lead the nose. The round palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and mocha alongside smooth tannins.
Name: Rossovermiglio 2015 Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, baking spice and a hint of violet lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers blackberry jam and star anise alongside smooth tannins.
Name: Tenuta Fontana 2015 Civico 28 Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, new leather and scorched earth lead the nose. The medium-bodied palate offers black plum, star anise and a hint of orange peel alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Antonio Caggiano 2017 Taurì Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Dark-berry, pressed violet and tilled earth aromas come together on this. The easygoing enjoyable palate offers ripe blackberry and a hint of clove alongside mellow tannins.
Name: Di Meo 2015 Isso Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Mediterranean brush, sunbaked earth, blue-flower and mature plum aromas lead the nose. The aromas carry on to the easygoing palate together with prune and clove while dusty tannins provide support.
Designation: Sant'Agata dei Goti Cesco de Nece
Name: Mustilli 2015 Sant'Agata dei Goti Cesco de Nece Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, forest floor and vanilla lead the nose. The juicy palate delivers ripe raspberry, white pepper and clove alongside smooth tannins.
Name: Alois 2015 Campole Aglianico (Campania)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched earth, ripe dark-skinned berry and leather. The juicy palate delivers mature black cherry, Mediterranean herb and a touch of mint alongside firm tannins.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2016 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Made with organically grown Aglianico grapes, this opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, tobacco and cooking spice. The firm palate offers black plum, clove and white pepper alongside taut tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Cautiero 2015 Fois Aglianico (Sannio)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with earthy aromas of leather, mature black fruit and toasted oak. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and mocha set against bracing tannins.
Name: La Fortezza 2010 Enzo Rillo Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark berry, scorched earth and cooking spice. The firm palate offers ripe blackberry, licorice and black pepper alongside chewy tannins.
Name: Villa Mattielli 2014 Rocca dei Leoni Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Aromas of ripe black plum, underbrush and vanilla emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers prune, mocha and toast alongside smooth tannins.
Name: Nativ 2015 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark berry, blue flower and a whiff of tilled soil. The easygoing palate offers black plum, orange rind and licorice alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Torricino 2016 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: American ex-pat Brad Hickey's wines are anything but boring. In this Nero d'Avola, left for six months in locally sourced clay amphora, aromatics are at the fore. Potpourri-like florals border on soapy, along with bright red berry, orange peel and herbal cocktail bitters. The palate is tightly wound and grainy-textured, with sappy, savory, vice-like tannins and a briney finish. Drink now–2028.
Name: Brash Higgins 2016 NDV Amphora Project Nero d'Avola (McLaren Vale)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, espresso and coconut lead the nose. Made with organically grown grapes, the dense palate delivers prune, roasted coffee bean and vanilla alongside closed-grained tannins. The heat of evident alcohol dominates the finish.
Name: Cautiero 2011 Donna Candida Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: This opens with aromas of espresso, scorched earth and cedar. The straightforward palate offers prune, vanilla and a hint of star anise alongside pliant tannins.
Name: Manimurci 2016 Campi Taurasini Rossocupo Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This opens with aromas of prune, leather and vanilla that carry over to the straightforward palate along with a hint of clove. It's easygoing, with pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Nardone 2016 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This has aromas suggesting Mediterranean brush, mature black-skinned fruit and scorched earth. The easygoing palate shows dried black cherry, baking spice and a hint of star anise framed in rounded tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Mustilli 2016 Aglianico (Sannio)

Appellation: Falerno del Massico, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, roasted coffee bean and vanilla. The dense palate offers prune, clove and espresso alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: Trabucco 2014 Rapicano Aglianico (Falerno del Massico)

Description: Aromas of dark berry and baking spice lead the nose. The simple palate delivers ripe blackberry, clove and a light peppery note alongside round tannins.
Name: Terredora Di Paolo 2015 Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, tobacco and cured meat lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried cherry, licorice and sage alongside chewy tannins.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2015 Rafè Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Dark-berry, spiced plum and vanilla aromas emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, clove and cooking spice alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: Di Meo 2014 Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Subdued aromas of dark fruit and scorched earth slowly emerge from the glass. The linear palate offers ripe black plum, espresso and vanilla alongside round tannins.
Name: Fattoria Pagano 2015 Aglianico (Campania)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Dark berry, tobacco and tilled earth aromas come together on this. It's easygoing, offering mature blackberry, clove and mocha flavors alongside mellow tannins.
Name: La Fortezza 2014  Aglianico del Taburno

Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, game and leather emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers prune, tobacco and a touch of tangerine zest alongside grainy tannins.
Name: Torre a Oriente 2012 'U Barone Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, scorched earth and mocha lead the nose. The straightforward palate delivers ripe blackberry jam, vanilla and a light peppery note alongside round tannins.
Name: Torre a Oriente 2014 Janico Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: This has a subdued nose suggesting baking spice and black fruit. The simple palate offers prune and confectionery notes alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Iorio 2016 Aglianico (Sannio)

Appellation: Naches Heights, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is one of the few examples of this variety in the state. Whole green and jalapeño pepper aromas are followed by notes of flower and cherry. The palate is lighter styled with a chalky feel. The concentration comes off as quite light.
Name: Wilridge 2016 Estate Wilridge Vineyard Sagrantino (Naches Heights)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this stunning red opens with delicate but alluring scents of wild berry, Mediterranean brush, rose, crushed rock and a whiff of exotic spice. It's full bodied but loaded with finesse, delivering creamy red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and white pepper. Taut, refined tannins and lively acidity provide support and balance, while a savory mineral note lingers on the close. Drink 2021–2036.
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Contrada G Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made entirely with native grape Aglianico, this stunning sparkler opens with enticing scents of Mediterranean scrub, bread crust, red berry and crushed stone. The dry, savory palate doles out juicy sour cherry, orange zest, strawberry, fennel, wild herb and flinty aromas alongside an elegant perlage and bright acidity. A mineral note reminiscent of oyster shell energizes the tangy finish.
Designation: Esse Rosé Dosaggio Zero Metodo Classico
Name: Dubl NV Esse Rosé Dosaggio Zero Metodo Classico Aglianico (Vino Spumante)

Description: Smoke, crushed stone, underbrush, aromatic herb and wild berry aromas lift out of the glass. Structured, focused and loaded with finesse, the savory palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice, ground pepper and a flinty mineral note alongside taut, refined tannins. It's balanced, with bright acidity. It already has a great depth of flavors but will develop even more complexity over the next several years. Drink through 2026.
Name: Wiegner 2014 Contrada Marchesa  (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: One of the wines that put Lambrusco back on the map, this vibrant, linear wine boasts aromas of wild strawberry, violet, red cherry and grapefruit. The aromas carry through to the slightly sparkling, savory palate along with cinnamon and white pepper notes. Crisp acidity lifts the savory finish.
Name: Paltrinieri 2017 Radice  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals subtle aromas evoking dark culinary spice, crushed rock, crushed herb and a whiff of blue flower. The palate boasts the firm's trademark of structure and weightless elegance, delivering red cherry, wild strawberry, orange zest, star anise and salty minerals alongside polished tannins. It's well balanced, with bright acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Contrada C Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Smooth and seductive, this offers aromas of wild berry, blue flower, dark spice, crushed rock and a whiff of Mediterranean brush. The polished, savory palate doles out juicy Morello cherry, strawberry, star anise and wild herb. Lithe tannins provide seamless support while bright acidity lends balance. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Pietradolce 2016 Contrada Santo Spirito  (Etna)

Description: Pronounced aromas of red berry, rose, flint and smoke lead the nose on this focused, vibrant red. It's elegantly structured, offering crushed strawberry, sour cherry, star anise, white pepper and iron. Taut, polished tannins and bright acidity provide support and finesse. Savory and ready now, it also has good mid-term aging potential. Drink through 2024.
Name: Wiegner 2014 Treterre  (Etna)

Description: Rose, wild berry, dark spice, crushed herb and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub lead the way. It's full-bodied, elegant and savory, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and a hint of tobacco alongside taut, close-grained tannins that leave a rather grippy finish. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Irene Badalà 2016 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Lavish dark-fruit flavors meld with moderately spicy oak nuances for a rich, layered and delicious combination. The wine is deeply colored, redolent of black cherries and blueberries in the aroma, and practically gushing with rich fruit and spice notes on the palate and finish.
Name: Klinker Brick 2015 Dolcetto (Lodi)

Description: Subtle but alluring aromas of wild berry, fragrant blue flower and menthol come together on this. It's elegant and structured, evoking succulent Marasca cherry, orange zest, star anise and a flinty mineral note alongside polished tannins.
Name: Pietradolce 2016 Archineri  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, exotic spice, espresso and a whiff of Mediterranean brush lift out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the tense, linear palate offers Marasca cherry, licorice, clove, wild herb and coffee bean alongside taut, close-grained tannins that give the finish grip.
Name: Cottanera 2016 Diciasette Salme  (Etna)

Description: This obscure variety thrives in small amounts in the appellation and is done justice by this bottling. A fruity palate of cherry, vanilla and strawberry is complemented by lavender and white pepper. Soft in texture, it's lovely and lingering on the palate.
Name: Summers 2016 Villa Andriana Vineyard 20th Anniversary Charbono (Calistoga)

Description: You'll find inviting scents of bread crust, orchard fruit and Mediterranean brush in this southern Italian sparkler. The creamy palate doles out white cherry, strawberry, candied citrus zest and nectarine alongside a foaming mousse and bright acidity.
Name: Dubl NV Brut Rosé Metodo Classico Aglianico (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright aromas of blueberry meet with earthy aromas and a tannic tension on the nose of this bottling, which comes from a vineyard deep in the southeastern corner of Paso Robles. A firm structure carries plummy flavors on the palate, which is relatively light on its feet, approachable and easy to like.
Name: Giornata 2016 French Camp Vineyard Aglianico (Paso Robles)

Description: Wild berry, Mediterranean scrub, underbrush and dark spice aromas form the nose of this immensely enjoyable, drinkable red. Smooth and linear, the bright, polished palate delivers crushed strawberry, juicy red cherry and ground black pepper alongside lithe tannins. An iron note marks the close. Drink through 2022.
Name: Planeta 2016 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese made in a well-integrated rustic way, this reflects both varieties in its embrace of soft, round flavors, including a mix of blueberry, dried cherry and clove.
Name: Ackerman Family Vineyards 2015 Alavigna Tosca Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Napa Valley)

Description: Blue flower, eucalyptus, oak-driven spice and dark-skinned berry aromas mingle with a whiff of pipe tobacco. The linear palate delivers Morello cherry, blood orange, licorice, espresso and a salty note. Close-grained tannins give it a firm, drying finish.
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2012 Musmeci Riserva  (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas suggesting tangerine zest, nut and orchard fruit, while the bright palate offers pink grapefruit, graphite, candied citrus and a hint of orange-flavored liqueur. A continuous perlage provides the backdrop.
Name: Paltrinieri 2016 La Riserva  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This deeply colored, frothy wine opens with aromas of iris, blackberry jam and baking spice. It's crisp, savory and dry, doling out prune, dried black cherry, star anise and white pepper set against bright acidity and dusty tannins.
Name: Villa di Corlo 2017 Corleto  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Description: Eucalyptus, dark spice and crushed aromatic herb aromas form the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the polished palate offers juicy cherry, orange zest, white pepper, clove and a saline-like mineral note. Taut, fine-grained tannins offer lithe support. Drink through 2026.
Name: Calcaneus 2016 Arcuria  (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Wild berry, dried rose, violet and an unusual but intriguing whiff of garrigue lift out of the glass. On the savory, fizzy palate, vibrant acidity supports succulent red cherry, white peach, strawberry, lemon zest and bread dough. It's fun and easy drinking but also loaded with personality.
Name: Medici Ermete NV Metodo Ancestrale  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Description: This has inviting aromas of wild berry that mingle with whiffs of wet stone and Mediterranean scrub. The full-bodied, polished palate offers Marasca cherry, ground clove, cured meat and a smoky note alongside a hint of iron. Drink through 2023.
Name: Pietradolce 2017 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Made entirely with Nerello Cappuccio, this reveals aromas of dark berry, Mediterranean brush and cooking spice. The juicy, balanced palate offers blackberry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside firm acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2016 Laeneo Nerello Cappuccio (Sicilia)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Celebrating the 30th vintage of this bottling, this wine opens with delicate scents of violet, strawberry and a whiff of baking spice. On the ripe palate, fresh acidity lifts mature black cherry, raspberry and candied tangerine zest before the dry finish.
Name: Cavicchioli 2017 Vigna del Cristo  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Strawberry, crushed herb and bread crust aromas follow over to the savory, softly sparkling palate along with watermelon and a hint of minerals. Tangy acidity provides fresh support.
Name: Francesco Bellei 2016 Ancestrale  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Description: Aromas of French oak, espresso and underbrush lead the nose along with a whiff of eucalyptus. Mirroring the nose, the tight palate offers ripe black-skinned fruit, oak-driven spice and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins that leave a firm, drying finish.
Name: Cottanera 2014 Zottorinotto Riserva  (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, nectarine and a whiff of vanilla lead the nose. On the bright palate, a soft perlage underscores white cherry, pink grapefruit and a hint of candied citrus. It's crisp, with vibrant acidity.
Designation: Rosé del Cristo Metodo Classico Brut
Name: Cavicchioli 2014 Rosé del Cristo Metodo Classico Brut  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: Made with Nerello Mascalese planted on the slopes of Mount Etna, this has aromas and flavors of red berry, peach, violet, crushed stone, bread crust and fennel. It's bright and refined, with a creamy mousse and a tangy finish of salted almond.
Designation: Mon Pit Brut Rosé Metodo Classico
Name: Cantine Russo 2011 Mon Pit Brut Rosé Metodo Classico Nerello Cappuccio (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, oak-driven spice and menthol lead the nose. The tight palate offers sour cherry, clove and white pepper alongside close-grained tannins that give it a drying finish.
Name: Calcaneus 2016 Feudo di Mezzo  (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of field flower, warm bread crust and a whiff of orchard fruit come together on this elegant sparkler. The bright, silky palate offers sour cherry, pear and tangerine zest alongside tangy acidity and a vibrant, refined perlage.
Name: Villa di Corlo 2017  Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this has a fragrance reminiscent of violet and thyme. On the vibrant, foaming palate, bright acidity lifts crushed raspberry, strawberry compote, candied citrus zest and a hint of culinary spice before a crisp, dry finish.
Name: Villa di Corlo 2017 Primevo  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Rose petal, wild strawberry and cherry aromas carry over to the bright palate along with a hint of white pepper. It's elegant and easy drinking, with a light mousse and fresh acidity.
Name: Cantina di Carpi NV Brut Piazza Grande  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Description: Full body and massive tannins make this an imposing wine that needs a juicy, fatty accompaniment at the table, or a number of years in a cool cellar to mellow. It has a deep, dark color, bold aromas of cranberry and dark chocolate, and tight fruit flavors like tart blackberries. The texture is dry and astringent. Best after 2023.
Name: Portalupi 2016 L. Venturi Vineyards Charbono (Mendocino)

Description: Aromas of toast, red berry and Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The bright, easygoing palate offers red cherry, wild strawberry and star anise alongside polished tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Al-Cantàra 2015 Lu Veru Piaciri  (Etna)

Description: Made entirely with Nerello Mascalese, this bright rosato has aromas of red berry, Spanish broom and a whiff of wet stone. The straightforward, tangy palate offers white cherry, peach and citrus alongside a saline note.
Designation: Amuri di Fimmina e Amuri di Matri
Name: Al-Cantàra 2017 Amuri di Fimmina e Amuri di Matri Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This foaming red opens with heady aromas of fragrant purple flower, rose and wild berry. On the tangy palate, bright acidity boosts juicy red cherry, wild strawberry and a yeasty hint of bread dough before the crisp finish.
Name: Cantina di Sorbara 2017 Omaggio a Gino Friedmann  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: Made with Lambrusco di Sorbara grapes, this bright sparkler opens with delicate scents of wildflower and red berry. The light-bodied, refreshing palate offers juicy sour cherry, pomegranate and pink grapefruit alongside vibrant acidity and an elegant mousse.
Name: Francesco Bellei 2014 Metodo Classico Lambrusco di Sorbara (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Deeply colored purple, this has vinous aromas of ripe blackberry and blueberry. The aromas carry over to the dry, vibrant palate along with hints of star anise, white pepper and dusty tannins.
Name: Cavicchioli 2017 Col Sassoso  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Violet, blueberry and cake spice aromas lead the nose on this semisweet white. On the lightly foaming palate, you'll find ripe plum, blackberry jam and a hint of cocoa while bright acidity keeps the rich flavors in check.
Name: Villa di Corlo 2017 Amabile  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, toasted nut and a whiff of grilled herb waft out of the glass. On the lively palate, a vigorous perlage underscores white peach, red cherry and a hint of candied tangerine.
Designation: Fulvio Beo Rosé Metodo Classico Brut
Name: Ca' Rugate NV Fulvio Beo Rosé Metodo Classico Brut Molinara (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: A white wine made with Nero d'Avola, this lively wine opens with wildflower and white stone fruit aromas. On the fresh palate, tangy acidity accompanies pink grapefruit, white almond and a hint of saline.
Name: Morgante 2016 Bianco di Morgante Nero d'Avola (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: Made with Lambrusco Salamino, this fun, off-dry red doles out aromas and savory flavors of spiced blueberry, raspberry, citrus zest and a hint of clove. Bright acidity and a foaming mousse give it an easy-drinking vibe.
Name: Paltrinieri 2017 Solco Semisecco  (Lambrusco dell'Emilia)

Appellation: Colli di Scandiano e di Canossa, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with Lambrusco di Grasparossa, this sparking red opens with aromas suggesting underbrush, truffle, fleshy black-skinned fruit and a whiff of wet fur. On the dry, foaming palate, fresh acidity lifts dried black cherry, raspberry jam and game before a dusty finish. It's a bit rustic but it's also savory and full of personality.
Name: Alfredo Bertolani 2016 Lambrusco Grasparossa (Colli di Scandiano e di Canossa)
Region: Colli di Scandiano e di Canossa

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild rose and red berry follow over to the bright, light-bodied palate along with raspberry compote and crushed strawberry. A note of candied tangerine zest and vanilla close the finish. It's fun and refreshing.
Name: Cantina di Sorbara 2017 Emma Amabile  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: White rose and strawberry aromas carry over to the dry, softly sparkling palate along with hints of culinary spice and blood orange. Tangy acidity lifts the juicy finish.
Name: Paltrinieri 2017  Lambrusco di Sorbara

Description: French oak, coconut and mature plum aromas carry over to the rather light-bodied, astringent palate along with hints of clove, coffee bean and a note of powdered sage. Raspy, grainy tannins dry out the finish.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2016 Rosso  (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Vinous aromas of strawberry, Marasca cherry and blueberry follow over to the vibrant, light-bodied palate along with hints of baking spice. It's easy drinking, with medium-sized, lively bubbles and bright acidity.
Name: Villa di Corlo NV Brut Rosato Rosanto  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Description: The nose offers aromas of Marasca cherry, candied orange and sharp angostura bitters over subtler tones of sawdust and aged oak. Fairly tart upfront in flavors of plum and red cherry, the palate is bolstered by sandy tannins and tangy acidity.
Name: Llano Estacado 2014 THP Montepulciano (Texas High Plains)

Description: Underbrush, charred earth, spiced plum, tobacco and star anise are just some of the aromas you'll find on this delicious red. It's enveloping yet structured, delivering dried black cherry, licorice and cocoa set against a backbone of velvety tannins. Hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Mastroberardino 2012 Radici Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: Aromas of new leather, aromatic herb, exotic spice, prune and cocoa follow over to the palate along with cherry, prune and star anise. A backbone of assertive, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provides an age-worthy structure, while a tobacco note lingers on the close. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Guastaferro 2013 Primum  (Taurasi)

Description: Aromas of exotic spice, mature black-skinned berry, cocoa and sandalwood lead the way. The palate boasts a weightless concentration, doling out mature black cherry, Mediterranean herb, clove and brown pepper. Firm, refined tannins provide seamless support. Drink through 2031.
Name: Mastroberardino 2011 Radici Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: This opens with compelling aromas evoking pipe tobacco, Asian spice, blue flower, leather, menthol and baked plum. It's firmly structured, offering dried black cherry, blackberry, licorice, nutmeg and crushed aromatic herb. Fine-grained, velvety tannins give it grip as well as elegance. Drink 2022–2037.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Feudi Studi Rosamila  (Taurasi)

Description: Concentrated and full bodied, this opens with inviting aromas of truffle, cocoa, ripe black-skinned fruit and balsamic notes. The aromas follow over to the juicy, jammy palate along with licorice and carob notes. Velvety tannins embrace the brooding flavors. Drink through 2026.
Name: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2011 Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: Aromas of spiced plum, truffle, iris, menthol and leather follow through to the juicy, concentrated palate along with fleshy blackberry, clove and licorice. Firm, velvety tannins provide support. Give this a few more years to fully unwind and develop even more complexity. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2012 Coste  (Taurasi)

Description: Wild red berry, dark culinary spice, blue flower, moist soil and flinty aromas escape from the glass. Elegant yet enveloping, the succulent palate evokes crushed raspberry, star anise, truffle and a whiff of Mediterranean herb. Polished tannins and bright acidity provide lithe support and balance. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Contrada P Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, scorched earth, spiced plum and balsamic. The juicy, delicious palate doles out fleshy black cherry, black raspberry, star anise and baking spice alongside polished tannins. It closes on a salty mineral note. It's structured and already enjoyable but will also offer fine sipping over the next few years. Drink through 2022.
Name: Antico Castello 2012  Taurasi

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, new leather, underbrush and a whiff of oak lead the nose. The firm palate shows prune, mature blackberry, cocoa and clove set against tight, fine-grained tannins that still need a few more years to unwind. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Mastroberardino 2011 Naturalis Historia  (Taurasi)

Description: Red fruit, exotic spice and blue flower aromas mingle together on this elegant wine. Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, the focused, linear palate evokes black cherry, pomegranate, star anise and wild herb framed in taut, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. It has great tension and will be even better in a few more years.
Name: Planeta 2014 Santa Cecilia Nero d'Avola (Noto)

Description: Exotic spice, French oak, menthol and Mediterranean scrub aromas all come out on this. Boasting an intriguing combination of structure and weightlessness, the elegant palate evokes Marasca cherry, star anise, tobacco and espresso framed in fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Rosso Feudo di Mezzo  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of black cooking spice, dark-skinned berry and blue flower swirl around in the glass. On the palate, firm, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity balance dried black cherry, clove and freshly ground pepper. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2013  Taurasi

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, blue flower, forest floor, smoke and a whiff of cocoa come together in this wine. The velvety palate shows nice tension, delivering black cherry, blackberry, licorice and tobacco set against taut, fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. A flinty mineral note energizes the tight finish. Give this time to come around to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2024–2032.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Feudi Studi Candriano  (Taurasi)

Description: Menthol, tobacco, blackberry and dark, exotic spice aromas slowly take shape. On the firmly structured palate, tense, fine-grained tannins support black cherry, licorice and clove. It's still young and tight, so give it plenty of time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Piano di Montevergine  (Taurasi)

Description: Star anise, violet, crushed herb and Mediterranean brush aromas align with a whiff of crushed stone. It's silky smooth, offering juicy raspberry, wild strawberry, dark spice and white pepper framed in lithe, polished tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance while a flinty mineral note energizes the finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Pipe tobacco, mature black plum, exotic spice, violet and new leather are just some of the aromas you'll find on this structured red. The taut, full-bodied palate is still young and austere, offering dried red cherry, black raspberry, star anise and chopped herb set against a backbone of bright acidity and assertive, fine-grained tannins that grip the finish. Give this time to fully come together. Drink 2024–2037.
Name: Guastaferro 2012 Primum  (Taurasi)

Description: Blackberry, truffle, fragrant blue flower and plum aromas follow through to the juicy palate along with baking spice and blackberry compote. Polished tannins lend finesse and structure. It's already delicious but will also offer good mid-term aging. Drink through 2024.
Name: Mastroberardino 2014 Radici  (Taurasi)

Description: Made entirely with Nerello Mascalese, this vibrant sparkler offers delicate, alluring scents of Spanish broom, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of sea breeze. It's savory and elegant, offering lemon zest, ripe orchard fruit and bread crust aromas alongside a soft perlage and bright acidity. A saline note fills in the finish.
Designation: Sosta Tre Santi Metodo Classico Brut
Name: Nicosia 2013 Sosta Tre Santi Metodo Classico Brut  (Etna)

Description: Winemaker Pietro Buttita loves to tackle unusual grape varieties and he did a great job with this one. The wine is beautifully concentrated and focused, practically bursting at the seams with black-cherry and blackberry flavors that are extremely ripe and potent. It's so intense that the fruit notes cling to the tongue and sides of the mouth, echoing on the finish.
Name: Prima Materia 2014 Aglianico

Description: Sunbaked soil, leather, game, crushed black olive and black-skinned berry are some of the aromas you'll find on this earthy, soulful red. The vibrant palate has great energy, delivering creamy black cherry, spicy blueberry, orange zest and carob alongside fresh acidity and lithe tannins. You'll be rewarded if you open this up at least a few hours ahead of time to let it breathe and fully open up. Drink after 2020.
Name: Occhipinti 2014 Siccagno Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made with Nero d'Avola, this polished, savory red offers aromas of black-skinned berry, carob and Mediterranean scrub. The juicy, chewy palate doles out blackberry jam, clove, black pepper and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.
Name: Curto 2013 Fontanelle Nero d'Avola (Eloro)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit, violet, dark cooking spice, crushed herb and a whiff of underbrush make for an enticing bouquet. On the firm, elegantly structured palate, taut, fined-grained tannins and fresh acidity balance dried black cherry, raspberry jam, black pepper and a hint of bitter cocoa. Drink 2021 through 2028.
Name: Villa Raiano 2013  Taurasi

Description: Pipe tobacco, star anise, baking spice, blue flower, menthol and blackberry aromas are front and center in this fragrant red. On the taut, medium-bodied palate, fine-grained tannins give structure to crushed raspberry, juicy Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of incense. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Terredora Di Paolo 2011 Pago dei Fusi  (Taurasi)

Description: Don't let the light salmon color fool you: This savory rosato is chock-full of flavor and brightness, opening with aromas of grilled herb, wildflower, red berry and a whiff of sea breeze. On the tangy palate, juicy acidity accompanies ripe cherry, tangerine zest, strawberry and graphite along with a hint of bread dough. White pepper and a salty note linger on the finish.
Name: Calcaneus 2017 Romice delle Sciare Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: French oak, mature plum and exotic spice aromas form the nose. The palate is tight and primary, offering sour cherry, cranberry, espresso and a hint of bitter cocoa alongside drying, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Don't even attempt until after 2025.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Feudi Studi Candriano  (Taurasi)

Description: Woodland berry, smoke, wild rose and Mediterranean scrub lead the way on this vibrant red. Racy and succulent, the savory, focused palate delivers juicy strawberry, red cherry, star anise and chopped herb alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. A saline note gives it a tangy finish. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Rosso Passorosso  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, orchard fruit, baked bread and wild herb form the nose. On the full-bodied palate, fresh acidity lifts raspberry compote, candied orange zest, and a hint of pastry cream. The finish lends a tangy mineral note evoking oyster shell.
Name: Irene Badalà 2017 Santo Spirito Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: Made with old, pre-phylloxera Nerello Mascalese vines, this opens with earthy aromas of wild berry, blue flower, crushed stone, leather and just a whiff of barnyard. The full-bodied palate doles out Marasca cherry soaked in spirits, star anise, white pepper and a hint of game alongside fine-grained tannins. A salty mineral note marks the close.
Name: Pietradolce 2015 Rosso Barbagalli  (Etna)

Description: Underbrush, mature black-skinned fruit and culinary spice aromas lead the nose. The dense palate offers dried blackberry, prune, licorice and powdered sage set against close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2032.
Name: Terredora Di Paolo 2012 Fatica Contadina  (Taurasi)

Description: Strawberry, wild rose, citrus and Mediterranean herb aromas take center stage on this fragrant red. Reflecting the nose, the focused, vibrant palate offers pomegranate, blood orange, star anise and hint of espresso alongside firm acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Cusumano 2016 Rosso Alta Mora  (Etna)

Description: Exotic spice, French oak, menthol and black-skinned fruit aromas merge together on this full-bodied red. The austere palate offers prune, dried cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside a backbone of close-grained tannins that grip the finish. It's still primary and needs several years to come around. Drink after 2025.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Feudi Studi Rosamila  (Taurasi)

Description: A distinctive and powerful fruitiness that's as rich as blackberry jam without being actually sweet gives this medium-bodied wine a big personality. Hints of spearmint and blueberry join the fun, and there is very little tannin or oakiness to get in the way.
Name: LangeTwins 2015 Red Tail Vineyard Nero d'Avola (Lodi)

Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, blue flower, wild berry and game fill the glass. The gamy note carries over to the succulent palate along with raspberry compote, crushed strawberry and dark baking spice. Polished tannins and fresh acidity provide supple support. Open at least a few hours ahead of serving to let this breathe.
Name: Occhipinti 2015 Il Frappato (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Delicately colored, this salmon-hued rosato offers enticing scents of white spring flower, wild berry and a whiff of Mediterranean herb. On the structured palate, you'll find white cherry, strawberry and a hint of baking spice set against tangy acidity.
Name: Pietradolce 2017 Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: Aromas suggesting pipe tobacco, blue flower, menthol, baked plum and a whiff of exotic spice take center stage. On the full-bodied, enveloping palate, firm, fine-grained tannins wrap around mature Morello cherry, licorice, prune and clove. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Torricino 2014 Cevotiempo  (Taurasi)

Description: Made entirely with black grape Aglianico, this refreshing, savory white wine opens with aromas of perfumed blue flower, wild berry and orchard fruit. The bright, rounded palate doles out juicy strawberry, white peach and a hint of crushed stone alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Mastroberardino 2017 Neroametà Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Tobacco, baked plum, French oak, aromatic herb and coconut aromas shape the nose. The extracted, brooding palate shows steeped prune, bitter cocoa and licorice alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2012 La Loggia del Cavaliere Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting blackberry, blue flower and an earthy whiff of tilled soil. On the soft, juicy palate, notes of mint and star anise accent a core of ripe black raspberry.
Name: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2015 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Juicy and polished, this offers aromas of sunbaked earth, mature plum, leather and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. On the dense, full-bodied palate, close-grained tannins give structure to dried cherry, raspberry jam, star anise and a dusting of bitter cocoa before a rather drying finish. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2012 Terra di Rivolta  (Aglianico del Taburno)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, scorched soil, leather and a whiff of game follow over to the enveloping palate, along with juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco. It's already delicious and velvety, so no need to wait to enjoy. Drink through 2022.
Name: Montesole 2011  Taurasi

Description: Intense aromas of crushed mint take center stage along with more subtle scents of black-skinned berry, leather and exotic spice. The minty note carries over to the firm, full-bodied but linear palate, along with black cherry and licorice tones. Firm acidity and tight, close-grained tannins provide the backbone. Don't even attempt this before 2025.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2013 Opera Mia  (Taurasi)

Description: Aromas of pipe tobacco, grilled porcini, leather, dark-skinned fruit and a whiff of dried aromatic herb form the nose. The palate shows prune, dried black cherry, sage and a hint of exotic spice alongside a backbone of assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the salty finish.
Name: Terredora Di Paolo 2008 Campore  (Taurasi)

Description: Made with 100% Nerello Mascalese, this has an alluring fragrance of Spanish broom, wild berry and Mediterranean brush. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts red cherry, pomegranate and a hint of star anise.
Name: Theresa Eccher 2017 Ariel Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: Aromas of oak, plum and exotic spice lead the way along with a whiff of smoke. The aromas follow over to the firm palate, together with prune, cherry, star anise and bitter cocoa. It's youthfully tight, with a backbone of bracing acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2025.
Name: Vigne Guadagno 2013  Taurasi

Description: Truffle, underbrush, leather, prune and exotic spice aromas lead the nose. The palate has a firm structure, offering dried Marasca cherry, bitter cocoa and star anise, as well as hints of oak. Drying, fine-grained tannins provide support.
Name: Case d'Alto 2012  Taurasi

Description: Underbrush, blackberry, menthol and a whiff of smoke lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the tightly knit palate along with dried cherry, blood orange, tobacco and licorice. It's youthfully austere, with assertive tannins and firm acidity, so give this time to fully develop. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014  Taurasi

Description: Aromas of stewed prune, chopped herb, pressed blue flower and nail polish remover lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers raisin, blood orange and clove set against firm acidity and tight, drying tannins. Give this plenty of time to unwind. Drink after 2022.
Name: Guastaferro 2010 Primum  (Taurasi)

Description: Forest floor, plum, baking spice and incense aromas lift out of the glass. It's concentrated, chewy and brooding, doling out blackberry jam, star anise and crushed mint framed in firm, close-grained tannins. Drink after 2024.
Name: Amarano 2012 Principe Lagonessa  (Taurasi)

Description: Made entirely with Aglianico, this savory rosato delivers aromas and flavors of wild raspberry, creamy white peach, Mediterranean brush and a stony mineral note. Tangy acidity gives it a clean, fresh finish.
Name: Mastroberardino 2017 Lacrimarosa Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Heady aromas of ripe strawberry, red cherry, clove and white pepper follow over to the vibrant palate alongside supple, polished tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and gives it a crisp, juicy finish. Chill slightly for a perfect summer red.
Name: Planeta 2016 Frappato (Vittoria)

Description: This has enticing aromas of tobacco, spiced plum, exotic spice and balsamic notes. The brawny, concentrated palate offers steeped prune, black cherry extract and licorice alongside fine-grained, velvety tannins. You'll also notice the heat of alcohol that throws the finish off balance. Drink through 2024.
Name: Le Masciare 2012  Taurasi

Description: Dark berry, Mediterranean brush and carob aromas take center stage. Made with Nero d'Avola, the smooth, juicy palate delivers ripe blackberry, ground pepper and clove alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
Name: Curto 2015 Nero d'Avola (Eloro)

Description: Truffle, ripe berry, rose, cocoa and Mediterranean brush aromas shape the nose. The firmly structured palate is a bit on the lean side, offering French oak, sour cherry, powdered sage and star anise set against bright acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Pietradolce 2016 Rosso Contrada Rampante  (Etna)

Description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and Mediterranean brush. The juicy, easygoing palate delivers crushed blackberry, black cherry and a hint of carob alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon to catch the fruit richness.
Name: Planeta 2017 La Segreta Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of game, wild herb, mature black-skinned fruit and a whiff of barnyard follow over to the dense, extracted palate along with prune and licorice. It's on the funky, overripe side, with a velvety texture that gives way to a dusty, drying finish. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit flavors and freshness.
Name: Antonio Caggiano 2014 Vigna Machia dei Goti  (Taurasi)

Description: Aromas suggesting oak, vanilla, baked plum and a whiff of burned rubber all take shape in the glass. On the assertive palate, grainy tannins offset fleshy black cherry, cake spice, espresso and vanilla before an astringent, drying finish. Give the tannins several more years to unclench. Drink after 2024.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2012  Taurasi

Description: Made with Nero d'Avola grapes, part of which were left to overripen on the vines, this opens with aromas of spiced plum, coconut and French oak. On the taut palate, close-grained tannins support dried black cherry, pomegranate, licorice and sage. It closes on a roasted coffee bean note. Drink after 2020.
Name: Stemmari 2015 Hedonis Riserva Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Oak, tobacco, vanilla, violet, blue flower and crushed herb aromas follow over to the dense, accessible palate, together with blackberry jam and spiced plum. Chewy, velvety tannins provide support. Drink through 2021.
Name: Antica Masseria del Sigillo 2011  Taurasi

Description: Made entirely with Aglianico, this enjoyable rosato opens with aromas of peach blossom and red berry. The bright, light-bodied palate offers raspberry and strawberry alongside crisp acidity and a refreshing finish.
Name: Rossovermiglio 2016 Incantesimo Rosa Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: Made entirely from Nero d'Avola, this opens with ripe dark berry, Mediterranean scrub and cooking spice aromas. The straightforward, bright palate offers fleshy black cherry, blackberry and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Stemmari 2016 Estate Grown Sustainably Farmed Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: One of the few bottlings made entirely with native grape Nerello Cappuccio, this racy, linear red delivers aromas and flavors of wild strawberry, blue flower, graphite and a hint of star anise. It's fresh and easy drinking, with lithe tannins and vibrant acidity. A savory, salty note marks the close. Drink over the next several years.
Name: Benanti 2016 Rosso Nerello Cappuccio (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Delicate scents of wild rose, woodland berry and Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The fresh palate offers red currant, pomegranate and a hint of saline alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Cusumano 2017 Alta Mora Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, underbrush, withered violet, black-skinned grape and eucalyptus mingle with a whiff of wet fur that eventually blows off. The palate is rather evolved, showing prune, espresso, clove and toasted hazelnut alongside drying tannins.
Name: Di Meo 2010 Vigna Olmo Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: Forest floor, black-skinned berry and dark spice aromas slowly appear in the glass. On the tight, assertive palate, close-grained, drying tannins accompany blackberry extract, prune and licorice alongside firm acidity. It closes on a note of powdered sage.
Name: Villa Matilde 2014 Tenute di Altavilla  (Taurasi)

Description: Earthy aromas of forest floor, scorched earth, leather, game and black plum shape the nose. The aromas carry over to the solid palate, along with black cherry extract and star anise set against velvety tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: D'Antiche Terre 2011  Taurasi

Description: This needed some time to open up but eventually revealed aromas of white pepper, pipe tobacco, blue flower and baked plum along with earthy whiffs of underbrush and leather. It's already evolved, evoking prune, licorice and a gamy note alongside velvety tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Di Meo 2009 Selezione Hamilton  (Taurasi)

Description: Wild berry, rose, nutmeg and French oak aromas slowly take shape in the glass. The lean palate recalls the nose, evoking raw sour cherry, star anise and a hint of powdered sage alongside racy acidity. Close-grained tannins give it a firm, somewhat astringent finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Benanti 2016 Rosso Contrada Monte Serra  (Etna)

Description: Blackberry, plum, tobacco and woodshop aromas lead the nose. Fruity and full bodied, the concentrated palate doles out black cherry, vanilla, espresso, licorice and oak alongside velvety tannins. Drink now.
Name: I Capitani 2013  Taurasi

Description: Dark berry, violet and baking spice aromas lead the nose. The juicy palate offers Morello cherry, blackberry and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: I Capitani 2016 Guaglione Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, dark berry and game. The simple palate offers blackberry jam and a hint of star anise alongside hearty tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Antica Masseria del Sigillo 2017 Sigillo Campano Aglianico (Campania)

Description: Wild berry, rose and violet aromas lift out of the glass. On the juicy, straightforward palate, fresh acidity brightens ripe strawberry, pomegranate and a hint of wet stone.
Name: Nicosia 2017 Vulkà Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of vanilla, dark-skinned fruit and camphor. The straightforward palate offers black plum jam, mocha and star anise alongside round tannins. Drink soon.
Name: I Capitani 2015 Campi Taurasini Jumara Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Prune, underbrush, scorched earth and cocoa aromas lead the nose, along with a slight whiff of barnyard. On the evolved palate, fine-grained but rather fleeting tannins support dried black cherry, raisin and a hint of baking spice alongside the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Nardone 2011  Taurasi

Appellation: Falerno del Massico, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tobacco, coconut and balsamic aromas emerge from the glass. The linear palate delivers prune, clove and mocha alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Trabucco 2016 Erre Aglianico (Falerno del Massico)

Description: This inky colored wine has subdued aromas evoking blackberry jam, ground pepper, eucalyptus and a whiff of woodshop. The dense, monolithic palate offers dried black cherry, bitter prune, star anise, oak and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent, drying finish. You'll also get a green note of powdered sage. Give the tannins another few years to soften, then drink to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Donnachiara 2015  Taurasi

Description: Tobacco, toasted oak and cured meat aromas lead the nose. The dense palate offers dried blackberry, oak-driven spice and a hint of powdered sage alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: La Guardiense 2015 Janare Lucchero Aglianico (Sannio)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose. It's very pale, almost amber in colored and a bit evolved, offering suggestions of white peach and citrus zest alongside a hint of tangy acidity. A saline note signals the close.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2017 Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: This opens with aromas of charred earth, smoke, eucalyptus and tobacco. On the evolved palate, you'll find suggestions of raisin, prune, vanilla and ground pepper alongside a backbone of firm acidity and drying tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Vigna Maurisi 2007 Principium  (Taurasi)

Description: Bright and easygoing, this fresh rosato has juicy flavors of wild red berry, dried herb and a hint of white pepper. Tangy acidity and a salty mineral note give it a succulent finish.
Name: Benanti 2017 Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: Packaged in an extremely heavy bottle, this has evolved aromas of steeped prune, scorched earth, cocoa and used leather, along with a whiff of nail polish. The densely concentrated palate offers dried cherry, blood orange, a hint of baking spice and a rather bitter note of powdered sage set against drying tannins. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol. Drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Tenute Casoli 2011 Armonia  (Taurasi)

Description: Aromas of wildflower, woodland berry and Mediterranean scrub lift out of the glass. On the fresh, informal palate, crisp acidity underscores pink grapefruit, unripe pomegranate and a hint of sage.
Name: Marilena Barbera 2017 La Bambina Nero d'Avola (Menfi)

Description: This opens with aromas recalling exotic incense, weedy underbrush and camphor. On the dense, one-dimensional palate, grainy but evolved tannins provide fleeting support for fleshy plum and raspberry jam before a short, raspy finish.
Name: D'Aione 2012  Taurasi

Description: Dramatic oaky aromas and flavors make this estate-grown wine a bit of a one-note song, as wood smoke and black pepper dominate. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and has a mouth-filling texture.
Name: LangeTwins 2015 River Ranch Vineyard Montepulciano (Lodi)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas that recall dark berry and baking spice. The aromas make their way over to the lean palate along with brisk acidity.
Name: Alagna 2016 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made from biodynamic estate-grown grapes, this is a powerful, intense offering from an Abruzzo icon. A heady mix of Thai basil, anise seed and purple flowers meld within a dense wild berry core. The palate is broad and gripping in youthful tannins, yet plush with a thick-skinned dark berry tone, and speckled notes of herbs and game that linger on the extended finish. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Emidio Pepe 2010  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Vibrant, vivid aromas of perfectly ripe dark cherry, blackberry and cranberry are covered in a delicate dusting of wet limestone and fresh herbs on the nose. The palate is all about texture, walking a tightrope between penetrating, juicy lushness and powdered, stony grip.
Name: De Fermo 2016 L.A. Concrete  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A wealth of ripe cherry, clove, toast and tobacco carries to the linear, focused palate. While this wine is held together by bracing acidity and a firm grip of tannins, there's enough fruit to broaden out the midpalate and carry to the lingering cherry-skin and spice finish. Drink from 2020 for things to soften a bit.
Name: Masciarelli 2011 Villa Gemma Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Incredibly vivid aromas of dark cherries and wild forest berries seamlessly meld with highlights of pepper, damp earth, blood-orange rind and stone. The plush yet persistent palate is equally vibrant and complex, offering loads of juicy berry flavors offset by delightfully grippy berry-skin notes.
Name: Annona 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: A defined nose of sauced blackberry and red cherry melds with a mix of charred tobacco leaf and walnut. This is a bruiser on the palate, boasting an abundance of firm tannins yet plenty of acidity for balance. It's deep and penetrating in feel, ending on a dusting of powdered, dried herbs and tar. Drink from 2022.
Name: Illuminati 2011 Pieluni Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Well-honed aromas of spiced black currant and dark cherry meld with bits of anise, clove and wild mint on the nose of this single-vineyard wine. The medium-bodied palate is taut in feel, broadened out by some dark fruit weight and supported by finely meshed tannins.
Name: Illuminati 2013 Zanna Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: Bright, ripe aromas of strawberry and watermelon meld with a dusting of white pepper and limestone on the nose. Medium in weight, with a rounded yet textured feel, this boasts a juicy red-berry flavor bolstered by plenty of cleansing mineral sensations. Bright acidity and a light grip of rounded tannins carries the palate to a lingering cherry-skin and limestone finish.
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2017  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

Description: Sourced from the winery's San Martino estate in Chieti, this wine is inviting in aromas of clove, tobacco and dill that waft over a dense core of red-skinned berries. The palate displays rich red-fruit tones underscored by oak spice, with fine-grained tannins and structured acidity delivering support and length. Give it time in the cellar to fully integrate; drink 2020–2025.
Name: Masciarelli 2015 Marina Cvetic Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Dense black berry and cherry meld with integrated oak tones of anise and clove in this red that sees time in Slavonian oak. There's a real sense of energy come first sip, displaying loads of thick-skinned berries framed by soft oak spice. This is structured with broad yet well-knit tannins and a healthy vein of acidity, ending on lingering cherry skin and cocoa notes.
Name: La Valentina 2015 Spelt Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Red-currant and dark-cherry aromas carry a bit of dried herb and spice tones on the nose. A well-knit juicy palate starts with plush red cherry then moves to a more taut cranberry flavor. Acidity is the driving force here, giving this a solid structure and energy alongside a proper tannic grip.
Name: Masciarelli 2014 Marina Cvetic Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A baked cherry core on the nose is brightened by fresher tones of blood-orange zest, anise and violet. This is juicy and buoyant in feel, boasting more of the same from the nose, with mouthwatering acidity and soft tannins. This is fermented and aged in concrete.
Name: Tenuta I Fauri 2016 Ottobre Rosso  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Sourced from organically grown fruit, this Montepulciano sees no time in oak, giving a completely unadulterated glimpse of the variety. This is bright in red-cherry and spicy blackberry aromas, underscored by hints of wet earth and flowers. The palate is equally vibrant in flavors of juicy thick-skinned berries and delicate peppery spice, with broad tannins and persistent acidity offering plenty of support.
Name: Cantinarte 2015 Ode  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: The top of the tier from the largest co-op winery in Abruzzo, Codice Citra, the brand name means “Praise to Life” in Latin. This is ripe and warming on the nose, displaying a wealth of dark cherry and blackberry supported by cocoa and allspice.
