It's well mannered and plush on the palate, yet still maintains structure from a dusting of well-knit tannins and a burst of juicy acidity.
Name: Laus Vitae 2012 Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This wine is sourced from a single vineyard that is over 1,000 feet above sea level in a mountainous region of Abruzzo. Well-honed aromas of fresh wild berries, zesty, peppery spices and delicate cherry blossoms start this off. The palate is concentrated yet lively, boasting racy currant up front that is broadened out by juicy red cherry, all supported by integrated, structured tannins and a focused line of acidity. Tangy granite and peppery spice tones linger on the finish.
Name: Valle Reale 2010 Vigneto Di Popoli  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: As a joint venture between Sabato di Properzio of Fattoria La Valentina in Abruzzo and Stefano Inama of Inama Azienda Agricola in Soave, this bottling starts off with aromas of sweet tobacco leaf and anise over a lightly spiced cherry core. The medium-bodied palate shows a solid intensity of tart cherry and currant, with a mineral twang and medium-grained tannins.
Name: Binomio 2014 Binomio Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: As the flagship wine from this large co-op, this is a delightfully approachable effort of ripe dark-cherry and rounded baking-spice aromas. Firmly medium in weight, this is fresh and fleshy on the palate, with a solid grip of tannins and a refreshing line of acidity.
Name: Citra 2013 Caroso Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A concentration of lightly toasted hazelnuts, cocoa beans and spicy red cherry covers the nose and palate. This feels broad yet shot through with an invigorating energy of acidity, all framed by well-knit yet structured tannins. Dark cherry skins and a bit of cocoa linger on the finish.
Name: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni 2015 Ursonia  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
Winery: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni

Description: A well-formed nose of tart red berries, smoke, fresh herbs and tobacco starts this off. Firmly medium in weight, the palate is well structured, offering integrated tannins and juicy acidity that house flavors of ripe cherry and currant. A dusting of herbs and smoke linger on the finish.
Name: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
Winery: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni

Description: Savory tones of black pepper, tilled earth, violet and eucalyptus start off this streamlined Montepulciano. The palate is light, bright and racy in tart red fruit, with a lightly peppered finish.
Name: Valle Reale 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Rich dark cherry, blackberry, clove and tobacco kicks off this wine that has seen time in Slavonian oak. Firmly medium in weight, this shows a nice balance of plush ripeness against a well-structured palate.
Name: Illuminati 2016 Lumeggio  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This rarely seen grape seems to do well in the warmer environs of Temecula, starting with aromas of snappy black raspberry and dark chocolate on the nose. The palate offers muddled black plum and elderberry flavors with just enough acid to carry through to the finish.
Name: Wilson Creek 2016 Cellar Select Teroldego (California)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: After taking a bit of time to open up, this offers a soft, juicy palate of dark-skinned berries supported by a dusting of tannins. A bit of sweet oak spice lingers on the finish.
Name: Nicodemi 2013 Neromoro Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: Aromas of fresh red berries, Mediterranean herbs and a bit of peppery spice show nice intensity on the nose. While light in body and soft in tannins, the palate offers a great sense of vibrancy and persistence in its brisk red-currant and broader red-cherry flavors that end on a lingering cranberry skin note.
Name: Pasetti 2014 Fonte Romana  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of ripe red cherry, black pepper and leafy tobacco carry to the medium-bodied palate. This boasts soft, supple tannins and a drying baking-spice finish.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2015 Jorio  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of thick-skinned black cherry and graphite show depth and complexity on the nose. The palate is rounded by a ripe red-plum flavor, with well-honed black-currant acidity cutting through spice tones. Soft well-knit tannins frame it all, giving this a easy, likable personality.
Name: Belpaese 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Condensed red-berry aromas carry a sharp spice note on the nose. Medium in weight, the palate is tangy and savory, boasting flavors of red-berry reduction, game and dried herbs. There's nice textural roundness, with soft, supportive tannins.
Name: Valle Reale 2010 San Calisto  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A ripe red-cherry aroma melds with loads of baking-spice tones: cinnamon, clove and anise. While fruit forward on the palate, with more sweet spice tones lingering in the background, this is well balanced by a slight grip of tannins.
Name: Cantina Zaccagnini 2015 Dal Tralcetto  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A blend of red cherry and Mediterranean herbs kick off this medium-bodied red. Ripe and juicy on the palate, soft tannins offer a well-knit structure to this wine.
Name: Illuminati 2016 Riparosso  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Ripe red-cherry, dried eucalyptus and clove aromas carry to the medium-bodied palate. Well balanced acidity and a mild grip of tannins give this easy wine enough support on the palate, making this a solid choice for everyday enjoyment.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2016 Podere  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of red currant, peppery spice and a hint of dried eucalyptus carry the nose. Flavors of tart blackberry and a bit of spice offer breadth to the medium-bodied palate, with zesty acidity and a firm grip of tannins giving support.
Name: Fosso Corno 2015 Mayro  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: An oaky sheen of charred herbs and anise ride over a core of ultraripe cherry in this wine. The palate is fleshy and soft yet still built up by supportive tannins and zesty acidity.
Name: Cantine del Borgo Reale 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: A well-formed nose of dried eucalyptus and violets carries to a sultry, soft palate of plum and blackberry. Medium-grained tannins offer a slightly sandy texture, yet the plush fruit and mild acidity balance everything out.
Name: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni 2016 Fonte Venna  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
Winery: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni

Description: This predominately stainless-steel aged wine is delightfully fruit forward, with a bit of integrated spice in the background. A ripe dark cherry tone takes center stage, with juicy acidity and a healthy grip of tannins offering structure.
Name: La Valentina 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Fresh red-currant and cherry aromas meld with delicate herbs and peppery spice on the nose. Soft and easy on the palate, this is light in feel but plush in red plum and cherry flavors.
Name: Masciarelli 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Ripe cherry and sweet oak-spice tones are in the fore of this easygoing wine. It's light in body and concentration, with rounded acidity and a delicate grip of tannins offering support.
Name: Illuminati 2015 Ilico Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Condensed black-cherry aromas meld with odd tones of fennel seed and caraway on the nose. Light in feel, the palate brings more of the same, with a dusty, tannic grip.
Name: Nicodemi 2015 La Murate  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: Dense cherry and currant aromas carry a mild intensity of spice and charred herbs on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is racy and tart in zesty cranberry and tangy mineral tones. Soft tannins offer a mild grip.
Name: Citra 2011 Caroso Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A wealth of cola, licorice and other sweet spice tones ride over a baked cherry core in this wine. The medium-bodied palate lends a bit more freshness, with ripe cherry and currant flavors showing more integration with the oak tones.
Name: Ferzo 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Sauced cranberry and cherry aromas carry a slightly spiced edge on the nose. Firmly medium in weight, the palate is a mix of savory fruit and fresh herbs that are supported by a delicate frame of tannins.
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2013 Tonì  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A wealth of ripe cherry and strawberry aromas carry an undercurrent of smoke on the nose. Made with organic grapes, this red is light in concentration on the palate, with a juicy red-cherry flavor leading the way. Soft acidity and light tannins give this an easy-drinking appeal.
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2016 Malandrino  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A fresh nose of ripe red cherry, mentholated herbs and dried hay start off this juicy, easy red. Light in feel, with a mild grip of tannins, this is well balanced in nature but lacks concentration.
Name: Fosso Corno 2016 Il Grande  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A mild concentration of wet earth, damp florals and spicy cherry carry the nose. This is light and lithe on the palate, with fresh red-fruit flavors accented by bright acidity and sandy tannins.
Name: Jasci & Marchesani 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Tight aromas of dark berries, wet earth and tobacco mark the nose. Firmly medium in weight and bolstered by dusty, grainy tannins, the palate offers tart red-plum and blackberry flavors that lead to an oak-spice finish.
Name: Nicodemi 2011 Neromoro Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: Cherry and strawberry aromas carry a warm spice undercurrent. The palate is lean and simplistic in its racy red-currant tone, with a mild grip of grainy tannins offering support.
Name: Niro 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Thick aromas of earthy truffle and sweet oak spice create a sheen over a quiet dark-berry tone. The palate is extracted and dense, yet shot through with sharp acidity. Despite that, there's a bit more fruit expression on the palate, with flavors of tart dark berries under a dollop of vanilla and clove.
Name: Cantina Ripa Teatina 2010 Spyro  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Baked cherry and warm spice tones carry this soft, plush red. There's a bit of midpalate heft to carry it along, yet this is ultimately a straightforward, easy pour.
Name: Belposto 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: This dense, plummy wine looks thick in the glass, with streaky purple legs. Bubble gum spice, menthol and blackberry-jam aromas lead to a tart dark-cherry palate. While slightly thick in feel, bright acidity and enveloping tannins offer a bit of structure to balance things out.
Name: Cantina Valle Tritana 2016 Tritáno  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: From a hot vintage, this wine shows a baked berry aroma on the nose, doused in tobacco, clove and other sweet oak spices. The palate is simultaneously plummy and ripe, yet harsh, with sharp acids and bitter tannins holding court.
Name: Farnese 2011 Opi Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of strawberry balsamic and dried hay carry to the tart red-fruit driven palate. This is lean in feel, with sharp acidity, gritty tannins and an astringent finish.
Name: Nicodemi 2015 Notàri  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: Opaque ruby in color, with a thin purple rim, this shows intensely confected aromas of artificial vanilla and sweet cereal grains on the nose. It's rich on the palate, with ultraripe cherry and blackberry flavors that are covered by a thick sheen of more sweet oak.
Name: Jasci & Marchesani 2014 Janù  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Quiet aromas of dark chocolate and mint mix with a bit of char on the nose. The palate is carried by a sweet oak tone reminiscent of Bourbon.
Name: Cantina Ripa Teatina 2013 Rocky Marciano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A dense nose of stewed red and black fruit carries a sheen of spice and resin. This is simultaneously sharp and thick in feel, with harsh acidity and grainy tannins underscoring ultratart berry tones.
Name: Jasci & Marchesani 2016 Nerubè  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: While plum-driven on the nose, aromas of carnation and hibiscus round out the bouquet. There's a chalky texture to the palate, with light tannins and piercing acidity, showing flavors of plum and black pepper.
Name: Scheid 2016 Riverview Vineyard Estate Grown Dolcetto (Monterey)

Description: Enticing aromas of juniper, Mediterranean herbs and pink peppercorn ride over a dark berry core in this riserva. There's power and intensity to the palate, with a juicy dark-berry flavor balanced by an earthy floral nuance. Well-structured tannins offer grip and persistent acidity offers balance, yet the fruit weight holds true through the lingering finish.
Name: Statti 2013 Batasarro Riserva Gaglioppo (Lamezia)

Appellation: Val di Neto, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from Magliocco, this structured red displays dense aromas of cherry, clove and cardamom on the nose. A firm palate carries a juicy dark-berry flavor bolstered by medium-grained, well-knit tannins, with a lingering finish.
Name: Librandi 2015 Magno Megonio Magliocco (Val di Neto)

Description: Ripe aromas of cherry, blood-orange zest and red flowers carry the nose. This is plush and soft on the palate, with vibrant acidity carrying flavors of juicy cherry and raspberry, ending on a herbal kick.
Name: Tenuta del Travale 2015 Eleuteria Nerello Mascalese (Calabria)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Loads of star anise and dried hay aromas waft over a core of bright red cherry in this wine. Soft, sunbaked red berries carry the medium-bodied palate, with bright acidity and well-knit tannins offering structure. An edge of savory granite offers freshness, with a sweet spice tone lingering on the finish.
Name: Quarta Generazione 2013  Aglianico del Vulture

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: An array of violets, tilled earth and dark cherry starts off this vibrant wine. The ample body is matched by juicy, rounded acidity and a grip of tannins, all supporting flavors of ripe black-skinned fruit and savory granite.
Name: Elena Fucci 2015 Titolo  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit shy on the nose, this bottling of a rarely seen Italian grape offers earthy and rocky aromas as well as very dark fruit. The palate is very mineral-driven, with crushed black-rock flavors, dried berry fruit and tightly wound tannins that leave the mouth coated.
Name: J Wilkes 2016 Lagrein (Paso Robles)

Description: A dense, powerful nose of brooding dark cherry and blackberry melds with shades of earth and barrel spice. This big, voluptuous wine is bolstered by medium-grained, grippy tannins and a wealth of ripe berry flavors. Cocoa-dusted cherries mark the close, along with a slightly hot finish.
Name: Produttori di Manduria 2013 Abatemasi Negroamaro (Salento)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a strong heavy wine, with dense blueberry fruit bordering on jam. Tannins are smooth and the finish seems drenched in chocolate syrup. There's nothing shy here, but the potent flavors and overall drinkability show the potential for Dolcetto in southern Oregon.
Name: Spangler 2015 Khayam's Block Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Tones of underripe strawberry, tobacco and slightly charred tarragon lead in this streamlined red. Racing acidity keeps the palate fresh while a bit of juicy red fruit broadens out the midpalate.
Name: Librandi 2014 Duca Sanfelice Superiore Riserva  (Cirò Classico)

Description: Spicy strawberry and dried herb aromas carry to the crisp, medium-bodied palate. Persistent acidity and a healthy grip of tannins house a zesty, tart palate, with a mildly hot finish.
Name: Librandi 2016 Rosso  (Cirò Classico)

Description: This Nerello offers notes of tar, spiced cranberry and Thai basil on the nose. Racy red fruit carries the persistent, streamlined palate, with soft, sandy tannins lingering on the close.
Name: Senatore 2012 Nerello Mascalese (Calabria)

Description: Spicy bramble berry and red-cherry aromas meet a rustic leather and barnyard backdrop. The palate is light in weight yet soft and plush in feel, with fresh acidity to balance. There's plenty of ripe red-berry flavor to make this enjoyable.
Name: Miali 2011 Ichore Negroamaro (Salento)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Notes of cedar, clove and toast ride over a dark cherry and blackberry core. Showing ample weight, this is balanced by soft acidity and a grip of medium-grained tannins. The palate carries a bit of an oaky sheen, but underneath there's a decent offering of fruit.
Name: Vigneti del Vulture 2015 Piano del Cerro  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: Ripe dark cherry, strawberry and sweet baking spice tones carry to the red-fruit-driven palate. This is smooth and soft in feel, with just enough support from juicy acidity and medium-grained tannins, ending on a sour cherry note.
Name: Statti 2016 Gaglioppo (Calabria)

Description: Savory red cherry, herbal strawberry and licorice aromas make for an easy-to-like start. This wine is simple and juicy, with tart red-fruit flavors blending on the soft, supple palate.
Name: Varvaglione 2014 12 e Mezzo Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Tones of spicy bramble berries, stems and sharp spices carry this light-bodied wine. Persistent acidity and grainy tannins give plenty of structure, but the fruit lags behind.
Name: Senatore 2016 Arcano  (Cirò Classico)

Description: Slightly stewed aromas of beets and hot pavement blow off to reveal a bit more freshness after time in the glass. Ripe blackberry, dark cherry and violet tones have a slightly thick feel on the palate, with medium acidity and firm tannins offering just enough support.
Name: Cantine Menhir 2015 Pietra Anna Primitivo-Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: Superripe cherry, bubblegum and cinnamon tones carry the aromas and flavors. The medium-bodied palate is plush and soft, with a mild grip of tannins. A confected cherry note marks the close.
Name: Felline 2016 Torreguaceto Pietraluna Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: A dense nose of baked blackberry, vanilla and bubblegum spice carries a slightly stewed quality. The medium-bodied palate shifts gears and offers a supertart and grippy palate, with a rusty metal finish.
Name: Felline 2015 Torreguaceto Sum Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: Made from a southern Italian grape grown in Carneros, this testifies to a happy new home. Vinified as a white wine, this is lightly orange in color and hearty in aromas of earth and flowers. Lively acidity supports a wealth of white peach, grapefruit and hazelnut, lightly ripe and easy to sip with abandon.
Name: Hudson Vineyards 2017 Estate Grown Aleatico (Carneros)

Description: Enticing scents of blue flower, rose, wild berry and Mediterranean herb aromas take shape in the glass. On the elegantly structured palate, bright acidity accompanies raspberry compote, juicy cherry and star anise alongside firm polished tannins. A flinty mineral note lingers on the close.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2014 Il Tascante Nerello Mascalese (Sicilia)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first offering of this variety from the valley, from a recently planted vineyard by the SeVein project. Aged 44 months in a combination of amphorae and new and neutral French oak, it offers tightly wound aromas of blackberries, tar, dark plums, minerals and spices. Though high in acid, it's full of firmly structured dark fruit flavors. It needs some food alongside it as well as time in bottle to be properly appreciated, but the stuffing is there. Best after 2022.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2013 Serra Pedace Vineyard Aglianico (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of ripe blackberry, mature plum, pressed blue flower and crushed mint come together in the glass along with a note of scorched earth. Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, the succulent palate delivers black cherry, steeped prune, star anise and menthol set against polished tannins.
Name: Feudo Montoni 2013 Vrucara Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with Aglianico, this savory sparkler offers aromas of bread crust, toasted nut, Mediterranean scrub and wild berry. It's tangy, with white-peach, wild cherry, ginger and citrus-zest flavors set against bright acidity. A soft perlage lends finesse.
Name: San Salvatore 1988 2014 Brut Rosé Metodo Classico Aglianico (Vino Spumante)

Description: Made entirely with Nerello Cappuccio, this opens with aromas of wild red berry, Mediterranean scrub, grilled herb and a whiff of dark baking spice. It's elegant and savory, delivering flavors of raspberry compote, juicy Marasca cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside polished tannins. It closes on a smoky mineral note.
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2015 Laeneo Nerello Cappuccio (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of menthol, oak-driven spice and dark-skinned berry slowly take shape on this. The chewy savory palate doles out plum, steeped wild cherry, licorice and mocha alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Firriato 2014 Soria Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically farmed Perricone grapes, this opens with aromas of raspberry jam, exotic spice, Mediterranean herb and star anise. The savory medium-bodied palate evokes prune, licorice and a dusting of mocha alongside a tight network of polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Feudo Montoni 2016 del Core Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark berry, cedar and mocha lead the way on this full-bodied Nero d'Avola. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, cocoa and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins that need another year or two to unwind. Drink after 2020.
Name: Morgante 2014 Don Antonio Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This is a very tasty, vivid red wine that sends up chocolate, cherry and berry aromas and equally expressive flavors tinged by an appealing earthy meaty note. While full bodied it is not heavy, due to good acidity that lifts the mouthfeel.
Name: Amador Cellars 2014 Martella Vineyards Montepulciano (Fiddletown)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with ripe black-plum, incense and cooking-spice aromas. The mature easygoing palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise with a touch of green peppercorn alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Morgante 2015 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: You'll find subtle aromas of cassis, underbrush and baking spice on this medium-bodied Nero d'Avola. The juicy palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise and a peppery note alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2015 Sorante Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: You'll find aromas of toasted oak, espresso and dark berry on this Nero d'Avola while the dense palate offers blackberry jam, cocoa and vanilla. Smooth tannins provide supple support. Drink through 2021.
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2014 Lu Patri Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with aromas of ripe dark berry, mocha and cedar. The ripe palate offers blackberry jam, clove and cooking spice alongside close-grained tannins that give it a firm finish. Drink 2019–2023.
Name: Feudo Maccari 2015 Saia Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Underbrush, grilled herb, plum and toasted aromas take center stage. It's structured and medium bodied, with tightly knit fine-grained tannins that support dried black cherry and steeped prune. It closes on notes of clove and ground pepper.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2016 Guarnaccio Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Subtle aromas of dark berry, vanilla and Mediterranean brush come together on this Nero d'Avola. The firm palate offers black cherry jam, mocha and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: MandraRossa 2014 Cartagho Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This grape variety is unusual in California, but it makes a good impression with aromas of roses, very ripe black cherries and cloves followed by ripe late-picked fruit flavors and a firm texture. It is full bodied but well balanced by good acidity to keep it from feeling heavy.
Name: Amador Cellars 2014 Aglianico (Amador County)

Description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this opens with dark fruit, cooking spice and Mediterranean scrub aromas. The savory palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and carob alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Graffetta 2016 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of wild blueberry, violet and a whiff of Mediterranean herb lift out of the glass. Made with Nero d'Avola, the easygoing palate offers juicy blackberry, wild cherry and clove alongside polished, fine-grained tannins.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2016 Lamùri Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, Mediterranean scrub and leather lead the nose. Made with Nero d'Avola, the round palate delivers blackberry jam, vanilla and a hint of dark spice alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2017 Coste a Preola Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This straightforward wine has aromas of red berry and tilled soil, while the lively easygoing palate offers candied red cherry, white pepper and a note of tangerine zest. Smooth tannins offer pliant support.
Name: Nicosia 2017 Fondo Filara Frappato (Sicilia)

Description: This simple Nero d'Avola presents aromas of dark berry, underbrush and clove. The informal, easygoing palate delivers black plum and vanilla alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Fazio 2017 Gabal Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This informal red opens with aromas of blue flower and ripe blackberry. It's soft and simple, suggesting flavors of blueberry and raspberry alongside pliant, not very persistent tannins.
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2016 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and toasted almond lead the way on this 100% Nero d'Avola. The structured balanced palate doles out ripe blackberry, raspberry jam, white pepper and a touch of cinnamon alongside bright acidity and fine-grained, elegant tannins. Enjoy through 2025.
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera 2015 Deliella Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Enticing scents of wild berry, Mediterranean scrub and dark spice abound on this elegant red. The refined palate delivers red cherry, crushed strawberry, white pepper and licorice alongside bright acidity and savory mineral. Firm polished tannins provide silky support.
Name: Cusumano 2014 Guardiola  (Etna)

Description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this opens with earthy aromas of Mediterranean scrub, cedar and ripe black-skinned berry. The savory concentrated palate offers black-cherry jam, tobacco, cinnamon and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Zisola 2016 Rosso Nero d'Avola (Noto)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This exciting wine points the way for this Italian variety in the Eola-Amity Hills. Rich, plush blackberry and plum fruit flavors, along with juicy acidity, create a bombshell of a wine that is near irresistible. There's a peppery bite to the finish, and it should continue to drink well for another five or six years at least.
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2016 Dolcetto (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: This fragrant and fresh red opens with red-skinned berry, violet and Mediterranean brush aromas. The easy-drinking palate offers raspberry, red cherry and clove alongside velvety tannins and bright acidity. Serve slightly chilled for a perfect summer red.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2017 Il Frappato (Vittoria)

Description: Aromas of forest floor, scorched earth, dark spice and a toasted note lift from the glass. The aromas follow through to the palate along with dried morello cherry, grilled sage and a hint of coconut while close-grained tannins provide support.
Name: Cottanera 2015 Rosso Diciasettesalme  (Etna)

Description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot, this opens with aromas of dark berry, leather and cedar. The firm palate delivers black-currant jam, mocha and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera 2016 Symposio Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with ripe black-skinned berry, carob and cedar aromas. The chewy savory palate offers dried black cherry, raspberry jam and cocoa alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Firriato 2013 Harmonium Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of ripe wild berry, baking spice and underbrush lead the nose. Made with organically farmed Nero d'Avola, the juicy palate offers raspberry jam, star anise and cinnamon alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
Name: Feudo Montoni 2016 Lagnusa Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Here's a Nero d'Avola that offers dark berry, underbrush and cedar aromas. The juicy palate offers mature black cherry, licorice and star anise alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera 2016 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of red berry, cooking spice and graphite emerge from the glass. The bright palate offers strawberry jam, Marasca cherry and clove alongside fresh acidity and round tannins.
Name: Firriato 2015 Sorìa Frappato (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of mature blackberry, tilled soil and Mediterranean scrub. The juicy palate offers blueberry jam, licorice and vanilla alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2014 Il Moro Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the second varietal offering in Ponzi's Italian series, a sibling to their Arneis. It's high toned and astringent, and sensitive noses may detect the scent of nail polish. Despite that volatility, it offers lifted raspberry and cherry fruit.
Name: Ponzi 2015 Dolcetto (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Made with organically cultivated Frappato, this fragrant red opens with heady scents of iris, red-skinned berry and Mediterranean brush. The forward easygoing palate delivers juicy black cherry, strawberry jam and a touch of black pepper alongside bright acidity.
Name: Vigna di Pettineo 2017 Frappato (Sicilia)

Description: Underbrush, Mediterranean scrub and dark spice aromas slowly take shape. On the taut palate, tightly wound close-grained tannins frame dried black cherry, coconut and dried sage before gripping the finish.
Name: Contrada Santo Spirito di Passopisciaro 2015 Animardente  (Etna)

Description: Made with 100% organically grown Nero d'Avola, this has aromas of black-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and a hint of raw almond. The juicy palate delivers fleshy black cherry, raspberry jam and black pepper alongside polished tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young, so drink soon.
Name: Caruso & Minini 2017 Naturalmente Bio Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and cooking spice. The lively palate delivers raspberry jam, black cherry and white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
Name: Donnafugata 2016 Sherazade Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this enjoyable red presents with earthy aromas of dark-skinned berry, underbrush and tilled soil. The fruity, savory palate offers succulent red cherry, strawberry and black pepper alongside round tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.
Name: Marilena Barbera 2016 Lu Cori Nero d'Avola (Menfi)

Description: Juicy and delicious, this friendly red hits all the right buttons, opening with enticing aromas of blue flower, black-skinned berry and Mediterranean brush. The smooth easygoing palate doles out mouthfuls of fleshy blackberry, ripe morello cherry and a sprinkling of baking spice alongside supple tannins.
Name: Planeta 2016 La Segreta Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of cedar, mocha and dark berry emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers black-cherry jam, vanilla and tobacco alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2015 Il Moro Limited Edition Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola has fruity aromas of strawberry, star anise and raspberry that carry through to the palate alongside notes of white pepper and black cherry jam. Juicy and straightforward, it's made to be enjoyed soon.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2017 Tenuta Ibidini Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, underbrush and cooking spice lead the nose on this Nero d'Avola. The savory accessible palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and a touch of white pepper. Enjoy soon.
Name: Assuli 2016 Lorlando Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit, underbrush and a whiff of carob glide out of the glass. Made with organically farmed Nero d'Avola, the juicy palate offers black cherry jam, cinnamon and star anise alongside round tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Vigna di Pettineo 2016 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with organically farmed Nero d'Avola, this offers aromas of dark-skinned fruit and scorched earth. The easygoing palate offers fleshy black plum, clove and black pepper alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Natale Verga 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically farmed Nero d'Avola, this has aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and a hint of cocoa. The juicy palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam and white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy soon to capture the fruit richness.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2017 Molino a Vento Vino Biologico Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with 100% Nero d'Avola, this has cedar, coconut and dark fruit aromas. The dense palate offers mocha, clove and blackberry jam alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Assuli 2015 Lorlando Riserva Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Here's a 100% Nero d'Avola that opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of cocoa. The juicy palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Feudo Solaria 2015 Foglio Cinquanta Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, Mediterranean scrub and dark berry lead the nose. The forward concentrated palate offers dried black cherry, prune, licorice and a touch of dried sage alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Firriato 2013 Ribeca Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with organically grown Frappato, this bright red opens with aromas of rose petal, raspberry and a note of black pepper that carry over to the round enjoyable palate. Soft tannins and fresh acidity give it an easygoing appeal. Enjoy soon.
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2017 Dumè Frappato (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of dark berry, orange zest and cooking spice that carry over to the lively palate. It's fresh and accessible, with bright acidity and smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Barone Sergio 2014 Nero d'Avola (Eloro)

Description: Here's a Nero d'Avola that has aromas of vanilla, baking spice and dark-skinned fruit. The straightforward, savory palate offers blackberry jam, white pepper and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Caruso & Minini 2015 Cutaja Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with native grape Perricone, this opens with aromas of dark berry, cooking spice and Mediterranean herb. The easygoing palate delivers ripe black cherry, cinnamon and black pepper alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2015 Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit and Mediterranean brush lead the nose on this Nero d'Avola. The easygoing palate offers dried black cherry and a touch of licorice alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Caruso & Minini 2016 Terre di Giumara Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Subtle aromas of dark fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers ripe black cherry and clove alongside soft tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2017 Molino a Vento Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of cedar, mocha and dark fruit glide from the glass. The straightforward palate offers black plum, espresso and tobacco alongside taut tannins.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Frappato (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of mature black plum, underbrush and cooking spice lead the nose on this young enjoyable wine. The easygoing palate offers blueberry jam, star anise and a touch of green peppercorn alongside velvety tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2017 Luce di Luna Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely from organically farmed Nero d'Avola, this offers aromas of dark-skinned berry and white pepper. The juicy palate recalls blackberry jam and licorice cushioned by round, smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
Designation: Vento di Mare Made with Organic Grapes
Name: Cantine Ermes 2017 Vento di Mare Made with Organic Grapes Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with aromas suggesting mocha, tilled soil and dark berry. The dense palate offers black plum, espresso and clove alongside rather firm tannins.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, tilled soil and a whiff of carob carry over to the easygoing palate along with a note of bitter almond. It's a simple but well made Nero d'Avola, with round tannins.
Name: Cantine Ermes 2017 Marchese Montefusco Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola shows delicate aromas of scorched earth, baking spice and a hint of dark fruit. The simple palate offers tobacco and black cherry jam alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Andrero 2016 Sessantasei Botticelle Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with dark fruit and tilled soil aromas. The simple palate offers suggestions of black plum, star anise and a touch of cocoa alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Botter 2017 Caleo Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with organically cultivated Nero d'Avola grapes, this opens with aromas of dark berry and underbrush. The simple palate offers black-cherry jam and star anise alongside velvety tannins. Drink soon.
Name: LaMura 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this informal red opens with aromas of dark berry, blue flower and underbrush. The easygoing palate evokes cherry jam and a hint of star anise alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: TerrAmore 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with restrained aromas of dark fruit and baking spice. The aromas carry over to the simple palate along with smooth tannins and a touch of black pepper. Drink soon.
Name: Cantine Ermes 2017 Vento di Mare Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This informal wine has aromas reminiscent of Mediterranean scrub, tilled soil and a whiff of dark spice. The simple palate evokes suggestions of mature black-skinned fruit, vanilla and orange zest alongside round, easy tannins. Drink now.
Name: Colosi 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This wine's ripe black-skinned berry, underbrush, graphite and balsamic notes unfold in the glass. The brawny, powerful palate delivers ripe blackberry, licorice, black pepper and clove flavors. It's well balanced, with assertive but refined tannins. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2012 Sacrantino  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, scorched earth and leather. The elegant, concentrated palate doles out red currant jam, ripe blackberry, white pepper, clove and cinnamon tones alongside assertive tannins. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Tenuta Bellafonte 2012 Collenottolo  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Black-skinned berry, graphite and leather aromas lead the nose of this structured wine. The concentrated palate delivers black cherry, tobacco and black pepper flavors held up by a backbone of assertive but polished tannins. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Cotarella 2012 RC2  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: This opens with ripe black-skinned berry, leather and earthy truffle aromas. The firm, concentrated palate offers cassis, blackberry jam, licorice and black pepper notes alongside noble tannins. Enjoy 2019–2028.
Name: Tenuta Bellafonte 2011 Collenottolo  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Underbrush, black plum and balsamic notes lead the nose of this wine. The concentrated palate offers prune, blackberry jam, mocha and licorice flavors alongside assertive but refined tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Adanti 2007 Il Domenico  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Made from dried Sagrantino grapes, this opens with blueberry, vanilla and nutmeg scents that carry over to the palate, along with coffee notes. Chewy tannins provide support while a cinnamon flavor closes the finish.
Name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2011 Passito  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: This opens with black-skinned berry and white pepper aromas while the bold, robust palate offers ripe black cherry, blackberry jam and tobacco notes. Tightly knit tannins and vibrant acidity provide the backbone. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Bocale 2013  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: This opens with subdued black plum and leather aromas. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, prune, roasted coffee bean and tobacco notes alongside assertive, grippy tannins. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Antonelli 2010 Chiusa di Pannone  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: This has ripe black-skinned berry and cooking spice aromas. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, clove and black pepper notes set against austere but refined tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Campo della Maestà 2011  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: This offers subdued baking spice and black plum aromas. It's densely concentrated, showing prune, raisin and tobacco flavors alongside close-grained tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Di Filippo 2013  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: This offers subdued dried black cherry, baking spice and raisin aromas while the palate evokes toasted almonds, prunes and black pepper. Polished tannins provide velvety support.
Name: Signae 2013 Semèle Passito  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this offers black plum and graphite aromas. The dense palate evokes prunes, licorice and tobacco, with close-grained, astringent tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Plani Archi 2012 Black Label  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this opens with subtle graphite and mature, black-skinned fruit aromas. The firm palate delivers roasted coffee bean, prune and tobacco notes alongside astringent tannins. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Antonelli 2012  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Blackberry, cooking spice and mocha aromas commingle in this wine. The firm, tightly structured palate delivers ripe black cherry, tobacco and black pepper notes framed by bracing, close-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2027.
Name: Perticaia 2012  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Made entirely from the native grape Foglia Tonda, this has a shy nose but eventually reveals underbrush and violet scents. The dense palate offers prune, cedar and tobacco notes alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Piandaccoli 2013 Foglia Tonda del Rinascimento Foglia Tonda (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely from the native grape Pugnitello, this opens with delicate tilled earth, cooking spice and black fruit aromas. The forward palate delivers blackberry jam, clove and licorice flavors alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Piandaccoli 2013 Pugnitello del Rinascimento Pugnitello (Toscana)

Description: Aromas suggesting tilled soil, black plums and mocha come together in this. The concentrated palate offers prune, blackberry jam and clove notes framed by austere, rather astringent tannins that grip the finish. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Adanti 2010  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Aromas of tilled earth, black plum and a hint of nutmeg unfold in the glass. The firm palate delivers espresso, prune and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Còlpetrone 2008 Sacer  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Cassis, ripe black-skinned berry and cedar aromas lead the way in this wine. The firm, dense palate offers fleshy black plum, clove and black pepper flavors alongside close-grained, astringent tannins that grip the finish. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Lungarotti 2012  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Game and black plum aromas lead the nose of this wine while the dense palate offers prune, licorice and toast notes. Assertive, somewhat astringent tannins and the heat of evident alcohol provide the backdrop. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: Plani Archi 2012 Brown Label  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: This opens with underbrush and black plum aromas while the dense palate shows coffee, vanilla, and prune notes. Tightly wound, astringent tannins provide the framework. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Signae 2009 Amedeo  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: This wine's tilled earth, leather and cassis aromas emerge in the glass. The ripe, rather evolved palate shows mature black plum, roasted coffee and licorice flavors alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: Còlpetrone 2011  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Aromas of smoke, strawberry and raspberry follow over to the young, fruity palate along with hints of star anise and flinty mineral. It's savory and easy drinking, with bright acidity and supple tannins. Drink through 2019.
Name: La Sibilla 2016 Piedirosso (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Bright red fruit, rose petals, carnation and cinnamon spice show on the nose of this promising bottling from a newer producer in Temecula. Zesty and lighter bodied on the palate with pomegranate and fennel flavors, this would be perfect for washing down pizza or pasta.
Name: Europa Village 2015 Vienza Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is bound to be controversial, because it incorporates a certain leathery funk in both aroma and flavor. The color is deep and the flavors punchy, showing full-bodied red fruit and potpourri. It was made from organic grapes and finished in stainless tanks.
Name: Viola 2016 Allegre Vineyard Dolcetto (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dolcetto has good potential in the Umpqua, though overall production remains quite small. Here, you'll find open, accessible strawberry and cherry flavors, with a touch of marmalade adding to the core concentration. It has good balance and should be consumed over the next three to four years.
Name: Delfino 2015 Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Blue wild flower, toasted hazelnut, wild berry and wet stone aromas lead the nose. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe orchard fruit and citrusy flavors.
Name: Mastroberardino 2016 Bianco Neroametà Aglianico (Campania)

Description: An extremely deep, dark color makes this wine stand out at first glance, and then it gives up equally vivid cedar and oak aromas followed by thick and potent blackberry and pomegranate flavors on the palate. Very firm tannins and some astringency finish the picture.
Name: LangeTwins 2013 Single Barrel The Eighty Vineyard Teroldego (Lodi)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a lean, nervy wine with firm tannins and edgy acidity backing the raspberry and cranberry flavors. It's medium bodied, lively and dry.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Heringer Vineyard Aglianico (Yolo County)

Description: Aromas of wild berry and strawberry jelly follow over to the creamy, radiant palate along with crushed raspberry and a hint of citrus on this lovely refreshing sparkler. Made with Lambrusco Marani, it has crisp acidity while a mineral note backs up the dry tangy finish.
Name: Medici Ermete NV Unique Rosè Brut Lambrusco (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This light-drinking wine is exotic for this neck of the woods, soft and dusty on the palate with a mix of Mexican chocolate and black-pepper spice. Plum and dark cherry add to its easygoing fruitiness and sophisticated approachability.
Name: Mengler Family Wines 2014 Alegria Vineyards Dolcetto (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Plump aromas of baked dark strawberries and caramelized plums meet with vanilla, baking spice and loamy soil on the nose of this bottling. The palate is broadly and softly painted with more baked red-fruit flavors, lifted by a licorice-like spice and cut by a twiggy earth element.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2014 Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)

Description: This may be the only wine made from this variety in the Napa Valley—a boldly fruity, structured and powerful wine strong in tannin and oak. Layers of well-developed flavors are defined by blackberry, black pepper and cinnamon stick.
Name: Benessere 2014 Estate Sagrantino (St. Helena)

Description: Here's a linear sparkler with delicate aromas of baked bread, custard and yellow apple. The aromas follow through to the vibrant palate along with toast and citrus zest. It's invigorating, with bright acidity and a lively perlage that lead into a dry finish.
Name: Cantina della Volta 2012 Metodo Classico Christian Bellei Brut Lambrusco di Sorbara (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aroma of bread dough, toasted hazelnut and yellow apple segue over to the racy palate along with lime zest. Brisk acidity and a vivacious perlage give it a crisp finish.
Name: Cantina della Volta 2013 Christian Bellei Metodo Classico Brut Lambrusco di Sorbara (Vino Spumante)

Description: Showing its age well, this pure expression of Negroamaro immediately engages the nose with aromas of concentrated berries, wild herbs and a hint of hoisin sauce. Round in feel, with structured acidity and supportive, fine-grained tannins, the palate offers a wealth of vitality in fresh red cherry, cranberry and streaks of granite. Savory herbs and earth tones linger on the finish. This is in a sweet spot now, so drink soon.
Name: Cosimo Taurino 2011 Patriglione Negroamaro (Salento)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A must-get for those attracted to obscure grapes, this cool vintage bottling of a northern Italian variety by Marisa Beverly (assistant winemaker at Au Bon Climat, and Jim Clendenen's niece) shows cranberry, strawberry, dried plum, baked earth and sumac-cinnamon spice on the nose. The palate offers strong loamy minerality right away, then settles into dried sage, peppery spice and tangy but dense dark fruits.
Name: Bevela 2011 Matela Le Bon Climat Vineyard Teroldego (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Named after the “Son of Apulia,” Frederick II of Swabia—the 13th century Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire who made his summer home the Castel del Monte, for which the DOCG is now named—this is a pure expression of the Nero di Troia variety. Aromas of dark cherries, spiced bramble berries, old leather and anise permeate the nose and carry through to a tightly woven, grippy palate. There's wonderful tension, depth and complexity to this medium-bodied wine which needs a few years to soften its tannic edge. Drink from 2020.
Name: Rivera 2012 Puer Apuliae Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: Named after the latin name of the Ionian sea (Jonio), this single-variety Negroamaro has a dense, permeating nose of jammy red and black berries, tobacco leaf, crushed cocoa nibs and graphite. Firmly medium in weight, the palate shows a vibrant force of tart berries and game that turns richer and riper come the midpalate, translating as a lingering red cherry note on the finish. Sandy tannins offer plenty of grip, yet the bright acidity and pervasive fruit tones keep everything in check.
Name: Gianfranco Fino 2015 Jo Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: This 100% varietal wine is juicy and dusty in concentrated flavors of cinnamon stick and baked plum. Firm tannins support without distraction and give way to a soft lengthy texture of fruit-forward approachability.
Name: Summers 2015 Estate Villa Andriana Charbono (Calistoga)

Description: Dark cherry and blackberry aromas meld with tobacco leaf and eucalyptus on the nose. Round and juicy in feel, there's a nice expression of ripe dark fruit struck against a taut line of acidity and medium-grained tannins.
Name: Cantele 2014 Teresamanara Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: This well-priced, aged wine offers aromas of brandied cherries, spiced game and herbs on the nose. Its round feel and soft tannins make it entirely approachable to drink on its own, while its savory palate and graphite finish make it a perfect accompaniment to braised lamb or duck. Drink now.
Name: Cosimo Taurino 2010 Notarpanaro Negroamaro (Salento)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tight at first, this wine opens to aromas of ripe red berries, tar and coconut shavings. The palate is rich in feel with dark cocoa bitterness, yet juicy acidity builds on the midpalate to reveal fresh berry tones. This needs time in the cellar to fully integrate. Drink from 2022.
Name: Tormaresca 2013 Bocca Di Lupo Aglianico (Castel del Monte)

Description: This single-variety Malvasia Nera is dense in purple-fruit aromas, with accents of violets, anise and menthol. The fruity, soft palate offers plenty of ripe dark-fruit flavors, balanced by fresh acidity and black plum-skin tannins.
Name: San Marzano 2015 Talò Malvasia Nera (Salento)

Description: Spicy, dense aromas of tobacco leaf, briar berries and tilled earth make for an engaging nose. The palate is a bit more primary in ripe dark fruit flavors, yet solidly balanced by fresh acidity and savory, medium-grained tannins.
Name: San Marzano 2015 Talò Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: This is a soft, juicy and approachable wine, in full grasp of grapey cherry flavors that veer overtly fruity. Medium bodied, it's a nice choice for the table, indoors or out.
Name: August Briggs 2014 Charbono (Calistoga)

Description: Aromas of dense dark-skinned berries meet spicy tobacco on the nose. There's ample weight, acidity and tannins, with plenty of rich dark fruit spice to fill it out. Chalky tannins currently dominate the finish. Drink from 2022 for easier enjoyment.
Name: Masseria Altemura 2014 Petravia Aglianico (Puglia)

Description: Light aromas of cherry, currant and wild herbs carry the nose. Medium in weight, with vibrant acidity countering sandy tannins, crunchy red fruit flavors dominate the palate, yet are restrained by a core of granite and crushed herbs.
Name: Polvanera 2013 Aglianico (Puglia)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Dense dark fruit aromas blend with sweet tobacco leaf and anise on the nose. Solidly built with grippy tannins and structured acidity, the palate offers a good concentration of more dark fruit, invigorated by accents of spice and crushed herbs.
Name: Rivera 2012 Cappellaccio Aglianico (Castel del Monte)

Description: This rare native grape creates a wine that is enjoyable in primary fruit expression. Floral and spicy, with a wealth of red cherry and black berry flavors, this is light bodied but crisp, clean and perfect with a slight chill.
Name: A Mano 2016 Imprint Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: A mix of black and red cherries carry the nose, with tobacco leaf and herbal spice tones in a more moderate concentration. There's levity to the mouthfeel from the crisp acidity and light, sandy tannins, yet the palate offers a good deal of racy fruit flavors that end clean and refreshing.
Name: Conti Zecca 2014 Donna Marzia Negroamaro (Puglia)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: High-toned cherry aromas meld with saw dust, anise and game on the nose of this pure expression of Nero di Troia. Light- to medium-bodied in style, flavors of savory bramble berries offer plenty of zip to the palate, with soft tannins giving just enough support. An herb-dusted cherry note marks the finish.
Name: Giancarlo Ceci 2014 Parco Marano Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: While oak dominant on the nose in aromas of roasted berries, the palate reveals a bit more complexity and balance. Medium-bodied and silken in feel, this shows ripe berry flavors, lifted by shades of violets and crushed granite. There's a slight dip in concentration on the midpalate yet overall this is enjoyable for its soft, approachable feel.
Name: Villa Schinosa 2016 Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: Strawberry jam and green herb aromas are joined by a delicate floral flavor on the medium-bodied palate. Bright acidity and grainy tannins lead to a crisp, dry finish.
Name: A Mano 2016 Negroamaro (Puglia)

Description: Rich and fruity, this bargain buy shows strawberry and blackberry jam aromas and flavors, speckled with green herb and floral tones. There's some breadth to the palate from the ripe fruit, yet enough tannic grip and acidity to maintain balance.
Name: San Marzano 2016 Il Pumo Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Sarsaparilla, cherry and blackberry show medium intensity on the nose. Light in feel, with juicy dark fruit flavors shot through with pomegranate acidity, the palate is supported by medium-grained tannins. A light cherry cola flavor rounds out the finish.
Name: Cantele 2014 Riserva Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)

Description: Spiced fruit cake aromas dominate the nose and carry to the medium-bodied, approachable palate. This is simple and straightforward with everything in balance—perfect for everyday enjoyment.
Name: Cantina Le Grotte 2015 Selva Della Rocca Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: Ripe red berry and plum aromas are covered in a sheen of vanilla and cocoa in this Negroamaro-dominant wine. Medium in weight, with a soft feel, enjoy this with hard cheeses.
Name: Leone de Castris 2016 Maiana Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine was aged in stainless steel—a rarity for a red in Washington. Aromas of herb, pepper, plum and dark fruit are followed by plump fruit flavors that paint a bit around the edges. There's much to enjoy here, though the middle seems somewhat missing. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
Name: Wind Rose 2014 Dolcetto (Yakima Valley)

Description: Aromas of strawberry, Mediterranean brush, blue flower, eucalyptus and a hint of new leather carry over to the radiant, elegantly structured palate along with red cherry and licorice. It's gorgeous, vibrant and almost ethereal, with weightless finesse and ultrafine tannins. Drink through 2026.
Name: Passopisciaro 2014 Contrada R Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Incredibly fragrant, this presents an alluring bouquet of dark-skinned berry, cake spice, blue flower, underbrush, crushed rock, exotic spice, spirit-soaked berry and balsamic notes. A combination of finesse and strength, it doles out juicy raspberry, Marasca cherry, licorice and baking spice alongside rounded, velvety tannins that give a smooth texture. It's a compelling wine. Drink through 2029.
Name: Passopisciaro 2014 Contrada G Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Compelling scents of ripe berry, rose petal, exotic spice and a balsamic note of eucalyptus fuse together on this fragrant wine. Structured and loaded with finesse, the concentrated, silky palate delivers juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and licorice while ultrarefined tannins and fresh acidity lend seamless support. Thanks to the smooth texture and mouthwatering fruit, you won't detect the 15% abv. Drink through 2029.
Name: Passopisciaro 2014 Contrada S Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of raspberry jam, Mediterranean scrub, menthol and a whiff of exotic spice lead the nose on this beautiful red. Concentrated but also boasting finesse, the juicy palate delivers black cherry, blackberry, licorice, clove, and crushed herb alongside firm, ultrafine tannins.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2015 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Red berry, crushed violet, dried herb and dark spice aromas take center stage along with whiffs of balsamic and menthol. The elegantly structured, juicy palate delivers crushed raspberry, ripe Marasca cherry, licorice and white pepper alongside smooth, polished tannins. A mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Tornatore 2015 Pietrarizzo Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Delicate scents of Mediterranean brush, crushed herb, flint, and balsamic notes of menthol and eucalyptus slowly take shape in the glass. The structured palate shows impressive breeding and class, offering dried Marasca cherry, pomegranate, clove and star anise framed in fine-grained tannins. A mineral-driven finish closes it down. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Passopisciaro 2015 Contrada S Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made from pre-phylloxera Nerello Mascalese vines, this compelling wine boasts enticing scents of blue flower, exotic spice, menthol and wild berry. It's dense and concentrated but also elegant, delivering mouthfuls of black cherry marinated in spirits, raspberry compote, licorice and well-integrated oak. Firm, close-grained tannins provide the tight framework. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Pietradolce 2014 Barbagalli Rosso  (Etna)

Description: An enviable combination of power and finesse, this wine boasts an enticing bouquet of new leather, ripe berry, exotic spice, graphite and a balsamic eucalyptus note. Full bodied but refined, the juicy, enveloping palate doles out raspberry jam, fleshy cherry, pipe tobacco and star anise framed in velvety, fine-grained tannins. A flinty note lifts the finish while the dense fruit masks the elevated alcohol content.
Name: Passopisciaro 2014 Contrada C Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Alluring scents of raspberry compote, crushed herb, wet stone and scorched earth take center stage on this full-bodied red. Firmly structured with impressive elegance, the palate doles out black raspberry, fleshy Marasca cherry and baking spice alongside velvety tannins. The juicy fruit seamlessly supports the warmth of alcohol. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Passopisciaro 2014 Contrada P Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, Mediterranean brush, menthol and dark spice develop in the glass. Elegant and spicy, the structured, focused palate evokes black cherry, crushed strawberry, star anise and clove while a mineral note lingers on the finish. It's well balanced, with bright acidity and firm, polished tannins. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: Passopisciaro 2015 Contrada P Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Restrained, subtle aromas of crushed rock, charred earth, Mediterranean scrub and eucalyptus take center stage. The smooth, elegant palate is ethereal and almost weightless, offering succulent strawberry, crushed raspberry, dark baking spice and a hint of anise alongside polished, silky tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2025.
Name: Passopisciaro 2015 Contrada R Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Mediterranean scrub, wild berry, dark spice, new leather, dried herb and a whiff of menthol take shape in the glass. The juicy, linear palate shows finesse and great fruit, doling out succulent red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and flinty mineral alongside silky tannins. Best through 2023.
Name: Passopisciaro 2015 Contrada C Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This opens with aromas of ripe plum, leather and cooking spice. The savory palate offers black-cherry jam, mature blackberry and a hint of tobacco while fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Enjoy through 2023.
Name: Montesole 2010  Taurasi

Description: Red berry, licorice and exotic spice aromas follow through to the smooth palate along with raspberry compote and menthol. Polished tannins provide supple support. Drink through 2021.
Name: Planeta 2014 Eruzione 1614 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of red berry, grilled herb, balsamic notes, sea breeze and a whiff of wet flint lead the nose. The elegantly structured palate delivers crushed raspberry, strawberry, star anise and a saline mineral note alongside refined tannins.
Name: Passopisciaro 2015 Contrada G Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas on this wine suggest underbrush, dried Mediterranean brush and exotic spice, with balsamic notes. The rounded, full-bodied palate shows cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and the warmth of alcohol alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Passopisciaro 2014 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Made entirely with Nerello Mascalese, this opens with aromas of Mediterranean brush, exotic spice, game and leather. The aromas carry over to the chewy palate along with dried cherry, licorice and ground clove while taut, fine-grained tannins provide support. Give the tannins another year or two to unwind then drink 2019–2020.
Name: Terrazze dell'Etna 2011 Cirneco Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Made with 100% Nerello Mascalese, this lively, polished sparkler opens with heady aromas of apple, citrus and toasted bread crust. The aromas follow over to the crisp palate along with a hint of almond set against zesty acidity and firm, continuous bubbles.
Name: Firriato 2014 Gaudensius Brut Metodo Classico  (Etna)

Description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of underbrush, black-skinned fruit and baking spice. The dense palate delivers prune, dried black cherry and vanilla, while dusty, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2022.
Name: D'Orta - De Conciliis 2012 Zero Aglianico (Paestum)

Description: Dark berry, white pepper and raspberry jam mingle with a eucalyptus note. It's a bit riper than usual but still boasts enough fresh acidity to support fleshy Marasca cherry and crushed Mediterranean herb. Soft tannins provide the supple framework. Drink soon.
Name: Planeta 2015 Frappato (Vittoria)

Description: Made entirely with dried Corvina grapes, this has aromas of red currant, toast and a touch of eucalyptus. The medium-bodied palate shows black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Brunelli 2015 Corte Cariano Corvina (Veronese)

Description: Enticing and earthy, this opens with compelling aromas of truffle, tobacco, black-skinned fruit, menthol and a whiff of blue flower. The palate is both structured and elegant, delivering dried morello cherry, prune and pipe tobacco framed in taut fine-grained tannins that give it a firm velvety texture. It's still tightly wound and needs time. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2012 25 Anni  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: What a treat to find a great rendition of this rare varietal. Concentrated black-fruit flavors pair beautifully with aromatic oak accents in this bold and complex wine. It has plenty of tannins to support the intense blackberry and blueberry flavors, while enticing cinnamon, cumin and leather come up in the aroma and last through the lingering finish.
Name: Judd's Hill 2014 Charbono (Suisun Valley)

Description: Plum, dark berry and baking-spice aromas slowly emerge on this full-bodied red. The taut spicy palate offers sour cherry, dried blackberry, ground clove and licorice set against a backbone of assertive but fine-grained tannins. It's still young and primary. Drink after 2025.
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2013 25 Anni  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Steeped plum, exotic spice, crushed mint and underbrush aromas take center stage. The palate is still youthfully austere, offering dried cherry, star anise and pipe tobacco framed in firm fine-grained tannins. Give it time to fully bloom. Drink after 2022.
Name: Tenute Lunelli 2012 Carapace  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Dramatic in aromas and opulent in flavors, this rich and gorgeously fruity wine has a great sense of layering and concentration, and a moderately tannic texture that feels layered and supple on the palate. Light spicy nuances dress up the focused black cherry and blueberry flavors.
Name: Klinker Brick 2014 Dolcetto (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, baked plum, dried mint and a balsamic note emerge in the glass. Brawny and dense, the meaty palate delivers licorice, ripe black cherry, raisin and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2018–2025.
Name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2013  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Aromas of licorice, underbrush, scorched earth and a balsamic whiff of menthol develop in the glass. Firm but elegant, the structured palate offers dried Marasca cherry, spicy blackberry and ground clove set against taut close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2012 Collepiano  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: This wine has a big personality. It's dark in color and oozing with ripe black-cherry flavors that intermingle with a high level of tannin for that lip-smacking tooth-staining effect. So approach with caution, and then enjoy for all its boisterous impact.
Name: Prima Materia 2013 Estate Bottled Aglianico

Description: This wine shows a grape jelly note that might be a little on the ripe side, but the cedary, cigar box characters balance things out beautifully. The palate is medium bodied, with a long line of focused acidity, herbs, an earthy core and a long cigar-box finish.
Name: 5OS Project 2014 Montepulciano (South Australia)

Description: Aromas of plum cake, chocolate and crushed mint jump out of the glass on this dense dessert wine. The syrupy concentrated palate doles out raisin, licorice, candied almond and marzipan alongside velvety tannins. Drink this after the meal as a meditation wine.
Name: Antonelli 2010 Passito  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This tiny maverick winery is doing wonderful things. This well-structured firmly textured wine offers a nice combo of ripe berry flavors, while touches of earth and oak give plenty to savor. It's medium to full in body, has moderate tannins, good balance and a lingering finish.
Name: La Folia Winery 2014 Dolcetto (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a dark, almost thick, velvet-textured wine with plenty of tannin and flavors of blackberry and black pepper. While mouthcoating in texture, its not overly full in body, and will pair well with cheesy pastas and rich meat braises.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2015 Teroldego (Amador County)

Description: This opens with aromas reminiscent of stewed plum, dark culinary spice, espresso and a balsamic note. The assertive palate is still tightly wound, offering dried black cherry, raisin, licorice and tobacco set against taut, close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Perticaia 2013  Montefalco Sagrantino

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This exuberant and friendly wine has delicious and very pure straightforward fruit flavors of black cherry and blackberry and a smooth non-tannic texture that make it easy to sip despite being full bodied. It's a very solid value and a great example of a unique Italian varietal grown in California.
Name: Enotria 2013 Dolcetto (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Red berry and pastry dough aromas lead the nose on this zesty, refreshing sparkler. On the tangy palate, crisp acidity and a lively perlage back up candied cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of citrus zest.
Name: Cantina della Volta 2011 Metodo Classico Brut  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Description: Aromas of prune, raisin and baking spice lead the nose. The youthfully austere, primary palate shows raisin and ground pepper alongside bracing tannins that clench the finish. Give the tannins another couple of years then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2013 Collepiano  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine has strong and tart blackberry aromas and flavors, a very firm and tannic texture and low alcohol. Hints of earth and new leather lend some complexity, but it will take time for this wine to relax for optimum enjoyment. Best after 2022.
Name: Portalupi 2015 L. Venturi Vineyards Charbono (Mendocino County)

Description: Leathery cherry aromas are pinched at first, then earthy and dusty. This uncommon blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese is nicely built and solid in feel. Chocolaty plum and berry flavors are lightly herbal and show a flash of cheesy oak on the finish.
Name: In Situ 2014 Signature Wines Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Dark berry aromas and fruity but somewhat subdued flavors are supported by firm tannins and good, mild acidity in this full-bodied wine. It is tasty and rather big in mouthfeel.
Name: Paskett 2015 Estate Charbono (Lodi)

Description: Weedy underbrush, salted game, exotic spice and cellar floor aromas are front and center. On the dense palate, oak-driven spice underscores baked plum while tightly-wound, grainy tannins provide assertive support. It's still extremely tannic but drink sooner rather than later to catch the remaining fruit.
Name: Goretti 2011  Montefalco Sagrantino

Appellation: Naches Heights, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the only bottling of this variety I am aware of in the state. The aromas are intriguing: all high toned, with notes of herb, barrel spice and ripe blackberry. The flavors are full bore, holding nothing back. The tannins bring a slight sense of astringency. There's promise.
Name: Wilridge 2015 Estate Wilridge Vineyard Sagrantino (Naches Heights)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, baking spice and chopped herb while the assertive palate shows dried blackberry, prune and clove. It lacks richness while close-grained tannins grip the tight finish.
Name: Di Filippo 2013 Etnico  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas suggesting toasted walnut and dried apricot follow over to the palate along with ripe orange zest. A soft perlage and bright acidity lift the finish.
Name: Cantina della Volta 2013 Rosé Metodo Classico Brut  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Description: Aromas suggesting nail polish remover, stewed plum, cellar floor and oak lead the nose. The evolved palate reflects the scorching vintage, offering raisin, powdered sage and balsamic notes alongside bracing grainy tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Signae 2011  Montefalco Sagrantino

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full bodied and firmly tannic, this bold wine has lots of berry and cherry flavors, tangy acidity and plenty of tannin, too. It tastes dry, almost tart, and leaves an astringent effect on the finish, so it needs to pair with rich fatty foods that balance it out.
Name: Amador Cellars 2013 Aglianico (Amador County)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fruity aromas of pressed grapes and blackberry are repeated on the slightly sweet, informal palate. Zesty acidity keeps it fresh while it closes on a slightly bitter note.
Name: Cavicchioli NV Robanera Abboccato  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a grape that's rarely planted in the Central Coast, this bottling shows loads of earthy aromas, from wet soil to crushed gravel, as well as tight blackberry, dried dill and white pepper notes. There's a touch of ripeness to the palate, with tobacco-laced red cherry and blueberry fruit, gravelly minerality and a firm, tannic structure.
Name: Ca' Del Grevino 2014 Estate Vineyards Dolcetto (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With its laser focus on black fruit flavors, this firmly structured wine has a distinct personality. Generous tannins and a good dose of fruit acidity provide plenty of grip on the palate. Each sip reveals more depth and layers, suggesting it's a good bottle to lay down for future consumption. Best after 2022.
Name: Uvaggio 2015 Vitigno Oscuro Charbono (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Stewed red currant, dried strawberry, sandalwood, mace and dried ginger notes show on the nose of this red. Intriguing mint, dill and anise flavors emerge on the palate, where underripe plum flavors meet black olive, dried sage and grippy tannins.
Name: Castillo's Hillside Shire 2014 Super Tuscan Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe black cherry, roasted meat, wet stone and caramel notes show on the nose of this bottling of a grape rarely seen in this region. It's slightly sweet on the palate, with ripe blueberry and cocoa flavors, but compelling for its novelty.
Name: Grevino 2014 Estate Vineyards Dolcetto (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This vibrant, slightly sparkling wine is one of the best Lambrucos out there. Made entirely from the Sorbara variety, it opens with enticing citrus, woodland berry and wildflower scents. Its crisp, delicious palate doles out strawberry and pink grapefruit notes alongside baking spice accents and racy acidity. The lees that have settled at the bottom of the bottle gives the last glass even more flavor.
Name: Paltrinieri 2016 Radice  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: One of Italy's most fascinating wines, this rare red is made from the grapes of 100-year-old, ungrafted vines. It opens with intense, inviting violet, dark spice and woodland berry aromas that carry over to its smooth, juicy palate, along with ripe Morello cherry, cranberry and ground pepper notes.
Name: Marcarini 2015 Boschi di Berri  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this boasts enticing blue flower, wild berry and cake spice scents. The fresh, elegant palate evokes strawberry, raspberry, candied nectarine and ginger, the flavors framed by vibrant acidity. It finishes crisp and dry.
Name: Cavicchioli 2016 Vigna del Cristo  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
