The juicy palate delivers flavors of ripe black cherry, blackberry and raspberry that are accented by notes of black pepper and cinnamon that add interest.
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2012 Donnatà Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Taurasi opens with earthy aromas of leather, mature black fruit and a whiff of barnyard. The palate offers bracing tannins and dense flavors of blackberry, black cherry and sugar plum that are layered with sugary-sweet vanilla, oak, toast and coffee.
Name: Donnachiara 2009  Taurasi

Description: Aromas of underbrush, leather, black fruit, mocha and subtle oak lead the nose of this young Taurasi. The palate is still young and tightly woven, but offers black cherry, prune and black pepper alongside bracing tannins. Drink after 2018.
Name: Villa Raiano 2010  Taurasi

Description: Blackberry, tart cherry, cranberry and carob take center stage on this fresh Nero d'Avola. Notes of black pepper and clove add depth to this easy-drinking style, while soft, supple tannins give it a round texture.
Name: Curto 2010 Nero d'Avola (Eloro)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with the native grape Casavecchia, this has a lovely fragrance of blue flower, tilled soil, leather and balsamic herbs. The soft, juicy palate offers supple tannins and fleshy blackberry flavor, accented with spice.
Name: La Masserie 2010 Vinalia Casavecchia (Terre del Volturno)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This big, earthy wine has aromas of ripe black plum, tilled soil, leather and coffee. The palate shows blackberry, prune marinated in sprits and black pepper alongside tightly woven and assertive tannins.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2010  Aglianico del Taburno

Description: This easy-drinking Aglianico offers succulent black cherry, plum and raspberry flavors accented by notes of cinnamon and clove. It's round, fresh and friendly. Drink soon to capture the juicy fruit.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2011 Dal Re Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Made from organically-grown grapes, this savory, light-bodied wine opens with fruity aromas of crushed red berries. The bright palate doles out juicy strawberry and sour cherry, lightly accented by notes of white pepper and mineral. Chill it for 20 minutes before serving for a refreshing summer red.
Name: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2013 Frappato (Sicilia)

Appellation: Falerno del Massico, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This Aglianico offers a mélange of aromas, including vanilla, toast, ripe plum, prune, tobacco and a whiff of leather. The palate opens with juicy black fruit accented by notes of vanilla, mint, tobacco and espresso, but excruciatingly aggressive tannins dominate the finish and give it an abrupt, drying finish. Give this time to unwind.
Name: Trabucco 2011 Rapicano Aglianico (Falerno del Massico)

Description: Here's a powerfully built Aglianico that offers sensations of extremely ripe black cherry, blackberry, chocolate, toast and subtle oak. The dense palate is supported by a solid tannic backbone.
Name: Luigi Tecce 2010 Satyricon Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This barrel-aged Piedirosso opens with aromas of tilled earth, plum, prune, tobacco and mineral. The palate offers black fruit and spice, but this has already hit its ideal drinking window and the juicy fruit is starting to dry, so enjoy this soon.
Name: Grotta del Sole 2009 Montegauro Riserva Piedirosso (Campi Flegrei)

Description: This delightful wine opens with blue flower, red berry and spice aromas. The juicy palate delivers black cherry, red raspberry, white pepper and spice alongside silky tannins and bright acidity. Made to be drunk young, it's perfect for everyday fare and informal occasions.
Name: Mustilli 2013 Piedirosso (Sannio)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a savory wine that opens with aromas of black berry, earth, leather and spice. The brooding palate offers mature blackberry, black cherry, black licorice and cracked pepper alongside big, chewy tannins.
Name: Basilisco 2010 Teodosio  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: This hearty Aglianico opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, mature black fruit and a whiff of leather. The palate delivers black cherry, mint and Mediterranean herbs supported by a firmly tannic backbone.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2012 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This all-stainless Dolcetto is anchored in pretty strawberry fruit and vivid acidity. It looks and tastes like a particularly deep rosé, or perhaps a lighter Beaujolais. Quite charming and delicious.
Name: Wind Rose 2012 Dolcetto (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made from the native grape Nerello Mascalese, this elegant wine opens with aromas of red berry, vanilla and a whiff of leather. The palate offers polished tannins and a creamy red-cherry flavor that's lightly accented by subtle oak and baking spice.
Name: Duca di Salaparuta 2010 Làvico Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Mature plum, blackberry and raspberry sensations take center stage on this young Nero d'Avola. The ripe fruit is accented by notes of subtle oak, espresso, black pepper and mint, alongside drying tannins.
Name: Duca di Salaparuta 2012 Passo delle Mule Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of blue flower, red berries, coffee and earth. The palate offers assertive tannins and dense black cherry and raspberry flavors that are accented by notes of black spice.
Name: Mastroberardino 2012 Redimore Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This concentrated wine opens with aromas of ripe black fruit, smoke and subtle oak. The densely packed palate delivers notes of black cherry, mineral and medicinal herbs. It's still young, with bracing tannins that result in a mouth-drying finish. Drink after 2018.
Name: Villa Matilde 2008  Taurasi

Description: Here's a dense but easygoing Nero d'Avola with sensations of blue flower, sweet black cherry, blueberry extract, clove and cinnamon. The soft, round palate offers juicy fruit, with a succulent blackberry finish.
Name: Ceuso 2012 Scurati Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Here's a bright and spicy light-bodied red made with the native Sicilian grape Frappato. This is loaded with strawberry, red cherry and raspberry sensations, and is lightly accented by white pepper. Chill it down for a refreshing summer red.
Name: FiàNobile 2013 Frappato (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This ripe Taurasi opens with aromas of nail varnish, overripe black fruit and hints of tar and tire rubber. The dense, extracted palate is loaded with mature black plum, stewed prunes marinated in spirits, chocolate and balsamic notes. It has bracing tannins but is shy on freshness.
Name: Il Cancelliere 2010 Nero Né  (Taurasi)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Here's an earthy wine that opens with aromas of tilled earth, ripe berry and game. The palate offers black cherry, ripe raspberry, plum, fig and coffee, with a note of bitter nut on the finish.
Name: Terredora 2010 Piedirosso (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Description: This informal wine opens with ripe red and black berry aromas. The palate offers crisp black cherry and black berry flavors that are accented by a note of graphite alongside nervous acidity. Pair this with pasta dishes topped with hearty sauces.
Name: Tommasone 2012 Per'e Palummo Piedirosso (Ischia)

Description: This young Aglianico is still closed but the palate eventually reveals black plum and black cherry accented by notes of black pepper. It has a brooding character, with bracing tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink 2016–2022.
Name: Villa Raiano 2012 Aglianico (Campania)

Description: This straightforward Nero d'Avola opens with aromas that recall violet, ripe black plum and tilled soil. The juicy palate offers ripe blackberry and Morello cherry, lightly accented by hints of white pepper. This isn't an ager so enjoy soon.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2013 Campo Reale Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine opens with aromas of plum, smoke, game, toast and espresso. The dense, extracted palate offers blackberry, coffee, licorice, oak, black pepper and spearmint alongside aggressive, astringent tannins.
Name: Terre del Principe 2011 Centomoggia Casavecchia (Terre del Volturno)

Description: Here's a delightful red that offers fruity aromas of strawberry, wild red cherry and raspberry that carry through to the palate alongside notes of white pepper and mineral. It's easy drinking, with bright acidity and a smooth texture.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2013 Tenuta Ibidini Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This dense and extracted Aglianico has toasted oak, chocolate, mocha, black cherry, espresso, vanilla and eucalyptus sensations. The palate is accompanied by teeth-coating, mouth-drying tannins.
Name: Colli di Castelfranci 2010 Candriano Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Made from organically-farmed Nerello Mascalese grapes, one of Sicily's most noble red varieties, this linear rosato is loaded with McIntosh apple, cherry and pink grapefruit. A hint of clove adds interest while crisp acidity keeps it fresh.
Name: Di Giovanna 2013 Gerbino Rosato di Nerello Mascalese Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This vibrant wine shows the lighter side of Aglianico while offering great value. It doles out juicy wild cherry, white pepper and clove alongside bright acidity and smooth tannins. Pair it with barbecue or hearty pasta dishes.
Name: Grifalco 2011 Gricos  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: This internationally-styled Taurasi opens with aromas of oak extract, sawdust, coffee and whiffs of black fruit. The palate offers blackberry, sour cherry, bitter cocoa and espresso alongside excruciatingly astringent wood tannins that dry out the mouth.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2010 Albertus  (Taurasi)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with delicate aromas of blue flower, black and red berries. The easygoing palate offers blackberry and black cherry flavors alongside bright acidity. Pair it with barbecue, or pizza.
Name: FiàNobile 2012 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Colli di Salerno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This young Aglianico opens with aromas of ripe black and red berries, oak, espresso, leather and vanilla. The concentrated palate offers red cherry, raspberry and licorice alongside drying wood tannins.
Name: Montevetrano 2012 Core Aglianico (Colli di Salerno)

Description: This Nero d'Avola has aromas of earth, black currants, game and a note of grilled bell peppers. The palate offers fleeting black cherry and black berry, accented by black pepper and a green note of dried sage. It finishes on a bitter note.
Name: FiàNobile 2009 Nero Capitano Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This robust rosato, made from the native grape Nerello Mascalese on the slopes of Mount Etna, is loaded with dark cherry and crushed strawberry sensations. The bright, juicy palate is accented by notes of cinnamon and vanilla. Pair this with appetizers, quiche or summer salads.
Name: Cottanera 2013 Barbazzale Rosato Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This dense wine opens with blackberry, plum, toast, earth and leather aromas. The palate is overwhelmed by oak, showing espresso, toast, spearmint and vanilla while licorice and blackberry sensations remain in the background. It lacks the fruit richness to support the heavy oak influence, and astringent wood tannins dry out the mouth.
Name: Terre del Principe 2011 Ambruco Pallagrello Nero (Terre del Volturno)

Description: This wine opens with aromas of prune, plum, blackberry and graphite. The palate offers raw red cherry, raspberry and a light touch of mineral alongside fresh acidity and drying tannins.
Name: Cantine Astroni 2012 Colle Rotondella Piedirosso (Campi Flegrei)

Description: This enjoyable wine opens with aromas of red berry, blackberry, blueberry and hints of white pepper that carry on to the palate. It has an easy-drinking style thanks to fresh acidity and smooth, soft tannins.
Name: Cantine Federiciane 2013 Piedirosso (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a young Aglianico that opens with aromas of blue flower, earth, plum and spice. The simple but savory palate delivers ripe blackberry, raspberry and black licorice alongside firm tannins.
Name: Bisceglia 2011 Terra di Vulcano  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: This jammy wine doles out overripe plum and mature dark-berry fruit, layered with a melted chocolate sensation. Warm and evolved, it has an almost sugary-sweet palate that's shy on freshness.
Name: I Capitani 2007 Bosco Faiano  (Taurasi)

Description: Made with native grape Piedirosso, this wine opens with berry, spice and mineral aromas along with a whiff of smoked ham. The palate offers fresh acidity and a black cherry flavor that's accented by black and white pepper.
Name: Agnanum 2012 Per e' palumm Piedirosso (Campi Flegrei)

Description: This wine opens with aromas of toast, black berries, espresso, balsamic herbs and black spices. The extracted palate offers up ripe black cherry, chocolate, coffee and licorice alongside bracing, drying tannins.
Name: Colli di Castelfranci 2010 Alta Valle  (Taurasi)

Description: Made from organic Nerello Mascalese grapes, this robust wine has sensations of mature black cherry that are accented by hints of balsamic herbs. It's not complex, but the ripe fruit offers easy-drinking pleasure.
Name: Di Giovanna 2012 Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made with the native grape Piedirosso, this opens with aromas of red berry, cracked pepper and a hint of orange peel. The palate delivers plum, black cherry, toast and espresso alongside drying wood tannins that cut the finish short.
Name: Sorrentino 2012 Frupa Piedirosso (Pompeiano)

Description: Here's a bright and fresh expression of Nero d'Avola that offers succulent black raspberry, sour cherry and ripe blackberry sensations, all accented by hints of cinnamon and spice. This easygoing style is made for sheer drinking pleasure, so enjoy now.
Name: Spadafora 2012 Alhambra Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This dense Taurasi opens with black fruit, toasted oak and chocolate aromas. The extracted palate shows a heavy oak influence and is framed by coffee, mocha and vanilla alongside evident alcohol and bitter, raw wood tannins.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2008 Opera Mia  (Taurasi)

Description: Here's a bright and easy-drinking expression of Nero d'Avola that offers sour cherry, ripe blackberry and pleasantly tart cranberry. Pair this with hearty first courses like four cheese gnocchi.
Name: Stemmari 2012 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This easy drinking rosato has pretty but fleeting aromas of strawberry and baking spices. The fresh, informal palate offers wild cherry, raspberry and a hint of clove. Sip this as an apéritif or pair with summer salads.
Name: Spadafora 2013 Rosato Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made from organically farmed fruit, this easygoing Nero d'Avola offers juicy blackberry and sour cherry lightly framed by a white pepper accent. It's simple but well-made, with bright acidity. Pair it with summer salads or pizza.
Name: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2013 Purato Made With Organic Grapes Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This ruby hued Nero d'Avola opens with earthy aromas of mature red and black berries, underbrush and a whiff of white pepper. The lean palate isn't very expressive, showing raw red cherry and a hint of roasted coffee bean. It finishes on a green, bitter note.
Name: Casa di Grazia 2011 Gradiva Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This extracted wine opens with aromas of toasted wood, coffee, mushroom, chocolate and vanilla. The dense, one-dimensional palate offers thick, jammy black fruit and oak extract.
Name: Vesevo 2008  Taurasi

Description: This warm, forward wine has sensations of nail polish remover, underbrush, resin, mature black plum and overripe black cherry. The evolved palate is framed by astringent tannins that dry out the mouth.
Name: Il Cancelliere 2007 Nero Né  (Taurasi)

Description: This extracted, dense and one-dimensional Taurasi delivers mature black fruit, fennel, black pepper, licorice, toasted oak and coffee bean sensations alongside drying wood tannins. It finishes abruptly.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2008 La Loggia del Cavaliere Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: Made with Aglianico, this simple rosé opens with aromas of sour red berries, crushed strawberry and cake spices. The casual palate offers sweet Morello cherry and pink grapefruit accented by notes of clove and sugary vanilla.
Name: Re Manfredi 2013 Manfredi Rosa Aglianico (Basilicata)

Description: Here's a simple, straightforward Nero d'Avola that offers concentrated blueberry and blackberry jam sensations along with a note of evident alcohol. Pair this with everyday fare like pasta topped with a hearty ragù sauce.
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2012 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This oak-driven Aglianico opens with aromas of coffee, toasted wood, espresso and black fruit. The dense, extracted palate offers oaky vanilla and sugar-plum alongside drying and astringent wood tannins.
Name: I Capitani 2010 Jumara Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Here's a monolithic Aglianico that has concentrated flavors of black cherry, blackberry extract and toast layered with dark chocolate, vanilla and coffee. The ripe, one dimensional palate closes on a sugary note.
Name: Nativ 2010 Eremo San Quirico Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of roasted coffee bean, toast and black fruit. The oak-driven palate offers espresso, black pepper and black cherry flavors, but it lacks fruit richness and ends on a note of drying wood tannins.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2012 Cantine Storiche Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Made with the native grape Gaglioppo, this soft, friendly rosato from Calabria has delicate raspberry, cherry and strawberry sensations accented by a hint of cooking spices. Pair it with appetizers, grilled vegetables or cold cuts.
Name: Librandi 2013 Rosato Gaglioppo (Cirò)

Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this opens with earthy aromas of tilled earth and ripe black fruit. The simple, one-dimensional palate delivers mature blackberry and plum alongside a fleeting note of black pepper. Enjoy soon.
Name: Di Giovanna 2012 Poggionotte Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Aglianico del Taburno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of new oak, vanilla, chocolate and overripe black fruit, all of which carry over to the one-dimensional palate. It seems tired, and the sugary sweetness, dense concentration and evident alcohol give the wine a lumbering character.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2009 Terre di Rivolta Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine opens with aromas of sawdust, oak, tire rubber, coffee and mature black fruit. The palate is also dominated by wood sensations, offering oak extract, roasted coffee bean, vanilla and espresso that smother the hints of ripe black plum that peek through.
Name: Vestini Campagnano 2011 Pallagrello Nero (Terre del Volturno)

Description: This dense Aglianico opens with aromas that recall resin, nail polish remover, stewed plum and chocolate. The meaty palate offers overripe black cherry and prune alongside aggressive tannins but it's evolved and shy on freshness. It finishes abruptly, with an astringent, tannic close.
Name: Sanpaolo 2008 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This unpretentious wine has a light fragrance of blue flower and black berry, while the simple palate offers fleeting black cherry flavors.
Name: TerrAmore 2013 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with aromas of toast, roasted coffee beans and wild berries. The palate is dominated by oak, offering espresso, tar, toast and black currant alongside astringent wood tannins. It lacks fruit richness and has an abrupt finish.
Name: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2011 Avulisi Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine opens with funky aromas of tire rubber and nail polish remover that carry over to the palate along with toast and expresso notes. It lacks fruit richness and has a green, bitter finish.
Name: Vestini Campagnano 2011 Casavecchia (Terre del Volturno)

Description: This wine opens with funky aromas of earth, wet leaf, black raspberry, vanilla and hints of farmyard and tire rubber. The tight palate offers tart cherry, cocoa, vanilla, espresso and oak alongside drying tannins.
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2011 Versace Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Here's an informal sparkler made with the Aglianico grape. The simple, fresh palate offers crunchy cherry, strawberry and pink grapefruit alongside bright acidity and vigorous, aggressive bubbles.
Name: Sanpaolo 2012 Jacarando Rosé Extra Brut Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: This wine opens with red berry, spice and spearmint aromas. The dense palate is surprisingly sweet, with sugary black plum alongside drying, rough, wood tannins.
Name: Vesevo 2010 Aglianico (Beneventano)

Description: Here's a simple and fruity Nero d'Avola that offers fleeting blackberry and tart red-cherry flavors alongside fresh acidity. Pair this with pizza or with other everyday, informal meals.
Name: Privitera 2013 L'Asispadi Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, underbrush, wet leaves, barnyard and mature black fruit. The muddled palate shows both sweet and bitter sensations of overripe blackberry, tart candied cherry, orange peel, vanilla, espresso and unsweetened cocoa, as well as astringent wood tannins. Panebianco, Vinity.
Name: Armosa 2008 Siclys Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Acrid aromas of sweat along with oak extract and toasted coffee bean lead the nose. The thick, extracted palate delivers oak, raisins and sugary sweet sensations of blueberry syrup together with evident alcohol.
Name: Nativ 2007  Taurasi

Description: Funky aromas of farmyard, tire rubber and fetid flowers waft from the glass of this Nero d'Avola. The muddled palate offers stewed prune, overripe black plum and oaky vanilla alongside bitter, green sensations of old sage. Panebianco, Vinity.
Name: Armosa 2008 Curma Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This rustic wine opens with aromas of underbrush, petrol and tire rubber, all of which carry over to the palate along with notes of sweet and sour sauce. It has a bitter finish.
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2012 Baglio del Sole Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Given 10 months in new French oak, this Dolcetto is firm and lush, imparting mouthwatering raspberry cobbler and smoky, cinnamon-cola aromas. Featuring resolved acidity, the texture is smooth and satisfying. It finishes leathery with a taste of earth.
Name: La Folia Winery 2012 Dolcetto (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Dark, rustic and plummy with layers of earthy meat and licorice, this medium-bodied wine is sourced from Tracy Hills and Lake County. Smoothly textured it's ready to go with cured meats and cheese.
Name: Rosa d'Oro 2012 Montepulciano (California)

Description: This structured rosato from northern Italy is loaded with bright red cherry, raspberry, black pepper and graphite sensations. The round, juicy palate is balanced by lively acidity that gives a refreshing finish.
Name: Nals Margreid 2013 Rosé Lagrein (Alto Adige)

Description: Enticing in toasty plummy spice and licorice, this Teroldego, maybe thanks to its bottle age, is soft and bright, showcasing the variety's earthy minerality and cherry fruit. Pair with something like braised Sonoma duck breast doused a cherry confit.
Name: Peltier 2007 Reserve Teroldego (Lodi)

Description: There are said to be fewer than 100 acres of Teroldego in California, so this one is worth trying. Midweight and fruity, it has lavender, anise and leather lightly folded into the mix. A good wine to start the evening and enjoy by the glass.
Name: Urban Legend 2010 Holland Landing Vineyard Teroldego (Clarksburg)

Description: Bright and cheerful, it offers fruity aromas of woodland berries, cherry and a whiff of white pepper that all carry over to the palate. Crisp acidity gives a clean, quenching finish.
Name: Mezzacorona 2013 Rosato Lagrein (Trentino)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A medium-bodied Aglianico, it's softly textured and light in red cherry fruit and plum flavor, with a hint of rose petals on the nose. Ready to enjoy now, the light imprint of this wine won't get in the way of food flavors, accenting something meaty or gamy that's not overly rich or overdone in sauce.
Name: Monte Volpe 2010 Aglianico (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Amador Foothill has two acres of Aglianico, an Italian clonal selection that the winery planted in 2003. There's a sweet liqueur quality to this wine, which otherwise offers intense, dusty plum and blackberry fruit notes.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2009 Estate Bottled Aglianico (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is a bombast of sweet liqueur and vanilla-infused candy, dusty with a sour finish.
Name: Montoliva 2010 Aglianico (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This gorgeous wine from southern Italy shows the true potential of native grape Aglianico. It opens with an intense fragrance of black cherry, leather, truffle, underbrush and spice. The dense, velvety palate delivers blackberry, raspberry and white pepper with a hint of espresso. It's already delicious but hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2027.
Name: Mastroberardino 2007 Radici  (Taurasi)

Description: This Taurasi, made from Southern Italy's noble Aglianico grape, unfolds with earthy aromas of tilled soil, black fruit and flint. The palate delivers a core of tight black cherry, tobacco, white pepper and smoke notes along with big velvety tannins.
Name: Donnachiara 2008 Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: This bold wine doles out vivid aromas of black fruit, earth, tobacco and spice. The palate offers layers of blackberry, cherry, currants and black pepper along with balsamic and mineral notes. It should develop more complexity over the next few years. Drink through 2018.
Name: Terredora 2008 Fatica Contadina  (Taurasi)

Description: An easy-drinking wine, it has pronounced aromas and flavors of cherry vanilla soda, blackberry preserves and just a touch of menthol.
Name: Klabjan 2008 Refosk Refosco (Slovenska Istra)

Description: A fruity fragrance of berry and cherry carries over to the palate along with watermelon and a hint of spice. Its refreshing finish make this an ideal apéritif or pair it with spicy pasta dishes.
Name: Spadafora 2012 Rosato Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This 100% Refošk has aromas of pomegranate juice, sour cherry pie and just a touch of barnyard scent in the complex bouquet. A bit austere on the palate, the dominant fruit flavors are black plum and dried red cherry. Think about giving this wine a few minutes in the refrigerator and pair it with grilled sausages.
Name: Piquentum 2011 Terre Refošk Refosco (Istria)

Description: Spicy and savory, it offers aromas of white and black pepper along with raspberry, dark cherry and hints of bell pepper that carry over to the palate along with aggressive tannins. Drink 2015–2021.
Name: Tenuta Luisa 2011 Refosco (Venezia Giulia)

Description: This wine boasts blackberry, raspberry, white pepper and earthy sensations. It's simple but well-made and cries out for food such as hearty minestrone soup.
Name: Lechthaler 2011 Drago Teroldego Rotaliano (Trentino)

Description: Made from the grape of the same name, this Freisa from Piedmont offers fragrances of blue flower and berry. The palate delivers ripe raspberry and tart cherry along with a hint of spice. Pair it with savory quiche recipes or grilled chicken.
Name: Pasquale Pelissero 2011 La Ferma Freisa (Langhe)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an enjoyable wine with notes of cherry lozenge, dried cranberry, coffee and herbs. It's lower in alcohol but with a weighty feel to the chocolaty fruit flavors.
Name: Kyra 2011 Purple Sage Vineyard Dolcetto (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Aromas of black berry and spice are accompanied by black cherry, raspberry and white pepper flavors. Simple but well made, this wine should be enjoyed young to capture the fresh fruit flavors.
Name: Castello del Poggio 2011 Dolcetto (Monferrato)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The 2010 Bello Rosso sticks to the 50-50 Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon formula, with a full, round, ripe and balanced palate. Fruity and forward, with citrus-accented cherry fruit, it pulls together the strengths of both grapes, with taut acidity and firm tannins.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2010 Bello Rosso Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is just the second time that this winery has released a Dolcetto, both sourced from the Dwelley vineyard. It's a very pretty wine, the color of Pinot Noir, and captures some of the feminine elegance of that grape as well. Scents of fresh crushed raspberries rise from the glass, lightly dusted with cocoa. Complex details of fresh herb add further interest.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2011 Dolcetto (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This opens with intense aromas of plum, berry and chocolate. The concentrated palate delivers ripe black cherry, prune and cinnamon-spice layered alongside vanilla and coffee. While the oak is very evident, the rich fruit supports the dessert-like flavors. It's round and ready so enjoy soon. Polaner Selections, Ambrosia Wine Group.
Name: Malacari 2008 Riserva Grigiano  (Conero)

Description: Plum, prune, black cherry and toasted oak sensations take center stage in this wine made from 100% Montelpulciano. The rich, dense cherry and crushed blackberry flavors are accented by mint, white pepper and a hint of espresso. Give this a few more years to tame the bracing, but fine tannins. Drink 2015–2019. Worldwide Cellars, A.I. Selections.
Name: Moroder 2009 Riserva Dorico  (Conero)

Description: This wine opens with a pretty fragrance of blue flower, black fruit and spice. The juicy palate is one dimensional but delicious, offering ripe black cherry and blackberry layered with milk chocolate. It's extremely accessible so enjoy soon.
Name: Fattoria Le Terrazze 2008 Riserva Sassi Neri  (Conero)

Description: Made from 100% Montepulciano, this delicious, friendly wine is loaded with mouthwatering black cherry layered with mint, nutmeg and black pepper. It's round, ripe and extremely approachable so enjoy soon. Pair with everything from hearty pasta dishes to barbecue fair.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2011 San Lorenzo  (Rosso Conero)

Description: Ripe berry and spice aromas take center stage in the 100% Montelpulciano from Marche. The ripe, round palate delivers juicy black cherry and black berry along with cinnamon-spice. There's no complexity here but it's ripe, round and delicious. Enjoy this soon.
Name: Angeli di Varano 2012 Primo di Tre  (Rosso Conero)

Description: A robust Montelpulciano offering aromas of ripe plum, black cherry and cinnamon-spice the carry over to the palate. The juicy fruit flavors are accompanied by supple tannins and a slightly warm mid-palate. This is all about immediate and easy drinking, so enjoy now.
Name: Marchetti 2011 Uve di  (Rosso Conero)

Description: Earthy notes of forest floor, tobacco leaf and black cherry open this wine made entirely from Montepulciano. The lush palate offers a core of ripe black cherry layered with cinnamon-spice, chocolate and coffee. While purists will say there's too much oak, the fruit is undeniably delicious. Not an ager so enjoy soon.
Name: Moncaro 2009 Riserva Vigneti del Parco  (Conero)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of tilled wet soil and black fruit. The juicy palate offers ripe blackberry and cherry, along with hints of white pepper and spice. There's no complexity here but this hearty food-friendly red is perfect for everyday fare—thanks to its delicious fruit and freshness.
Name: Illuminati Dino 2012 Riparosso  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This opens with leafy underbrush aromas accompanied by whiffs of blue flower, rubber and toasted oak. The palate's oak-driven sensations of chocolate and coffee muffle the restrained blackberry and black cherry flavors. Polaner Selections, Ambrosia Wine Group.
Name: Malacari 2009 Villa Malacari  (Rosso Conero)

Description: Made entirely with Montepulciano, this opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil along with notes of black fruit and espresso. The linear palate delivers bright red cherry, notes of mocha and somewhat astringent tannins. Straightforward and simple, this should be enjoyed soon.
Name: Conte Leopardi 2010 Fructus  (Rosso Conero)

Description: Made from 100% Montepulciano, this opens with aromas of blue flower, blackberry and espresso. Juicy fruit notes take center stage on the palate, along with notes of vanilla and chocolate, yet ends on a dry, tannic note. Not much complexity here so enjoy this soon.
Name: Garofoli 2010 Piancarda  (Rosso Conero)

Description: This opens with leafy underbrush aromas, alongside toasted oak and tobacco. The palate is on the lean side, offering prune, dried cherry, espresso and fig alongside tight, astringent tannins. This is fading, so drink soon.
Name: Conte Leopardi 2006 Riserva Pigmento  (Conero)

Description: This smells like burnt tire rubber, oak and coffee. The palate demonstrates faint notes of restrained plum, but toasted oak, chocolate and espresso dominate in a style reminiscent of the late 1990s. Bitter wood tannins finish this off.
Name: Garofoli 2008 Grosso Argontano  (Rosso Conero)

Description: Notes of toasted oak and vanilla are the opening notes of this wine. The palate has ripe plum and blackberry that are overwhelmed by oak, espresso, coffee and sweet vanilla bean. Too much oak and too little fruit.
Name: Angeli di Varano 2010 Riserva Stile Libero  (Conero)

Description: Oak and alcohol aromas dominate this wine made from 100% Montepulciano. The palate delivers café au lait and espresso, blueberry, chocolate and mint alongside the warmth of alcohol. It's starting to fade, so drink soon.
Name: Piantate Lunghe 2009 Riserva Rossini  (Conero)

Description: This shows more oak than fruit. It opens with aromas of toasted oak, chocolate, vanilla and espresso that all carry over to the palate along with a note of spearmint chewing gum. Plum notes are strangled beneath and it closes on a note of bitter wood tannins.
Name: Marchetti 2010 Riserva Villa Bonomi  (Conero)

Description: Made from 100% Montepulciano, this opens with unusual aromas of tire rubber. Dense black fruit flavors are accented with hints of white pepper alongside astringent tannins. Already approachable, the palate is straightforward and one dimensional. Drink soon.
Name: Fattoria Le Terrazze 2011  Rosso Conero

Description: Made from 100% Montepulciano, this opens with aromas of rubber, coffee and espresso. The palate offers black fruit sensations, alongside slightly bitter tannins. This is simply structured and already accessible, so drink soon.
Name: Piantate Lunghe 2011  Rosso Conero

Description: Here's a bright, simple and thoroughly enjoyable wine. It's loaded with blackberry and white pepper notes. While it's one dimensional, it's also robust and delicious. Pair this with hearty pastas topped with meat sauces.
Name: Casa Girelli 2011 Canaletto  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This wine opens with aromas of underbrush, tobacco leaf and forest floor. The palate is a bit lean, with coffee and espresso beating out the raspberry and black cherry beneath the surface. The fruit seems to be drying up fast so drink soon.
Name: Conte Leopardi 2010 Villa Marina  (Rosso Conero)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This bold, beautiful wine opens with earthy aromas of freshly tilled soil, violets, truffle and leather. The delicious palate offers succulent blackberry, woodland berry and cinnamon-spice accompanied by big, brooding tannins. It's already stunning, but give this terroir-driven wine time to develop even more complexity. Drink 2015–2024.
Name: Milziade Antano 2009 Colleallodole  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This stunning offering is aged in large casks that soften the wine but don't add wood tannins to Sagrantino's naturally tannic backbone. It opens with an intensely balsamic fragrance of Mediterranean herbs, mint and berry accompanied by delicious blackberry, white pepper and cinnamon flavors. The wine boasts fantastic depth and will develop even more complexity over time. Drink 2017–2027.
Name: Tenuta Castelbuono 2007  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: From one of the longest established producers in Montefalco, this gorgeous wine shows the real potential of Sagrantino. It has an alluring fragrance of rose, violet, berry, spice and leather while the palate delivers lush black cherry, blackberry, licorice and white pepper. It has powerful but ripe tannins alongside vibrant acidity, and will develop beautifully. Drink 2015–2029.
Name: Milziade Antano 2009  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine deserves its lofty reputation as one of Italy's premier bottlings. It opens with a gorgeous fragrance of berry, leather, truffle and spice. The palate delivers ripe and delicious black cherry, black berry, white pepper and chocolate notes accompanied by firm but refined tannins. This will age beautifully and develop complexity for decades. Drink 2016–2028.
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2008 25 Anni  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a stunning expression that opens with earthy aromas of blue flower, underbrush and leather, as well as black fruit and spice. The palate offers creamy cherry, black berry, white pepper and tobacco, with a hint of clove. The fresh acidity—surprising for the hot vintage—balances out the firm but ripe tannins. Best 2017–2027.
Name: Goretti 2007  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fermented with only wild yeasts and aged in large Slavonian casks, this is a bold and delicious wine, delivering earthy aromas of tilled soil, spice and berry. The palate delivers layers of blackberry, dark cherry, cinnamon, white pepper and licorice alongside bracing but ripe tannins. This will age well and develop complexity. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Tenuta Bellafonte 2009  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Description: Here's an exciting dessert wine that opens with an intense fragrance of mint, thyme and berry. The concentrated palate offers ripe cherry, berry, mint and thyme flavors, with a hint of tangerine peel. The rich flavors are brightened by fresh acidity that leaves a clean rather than cloying finish.
Name: Barberani 2007 Aleatico (Umbria)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This powerful Sagrantino opens with aromas of meat juice, truffle and black fruit. The palate offers blackberry, black cherry, cinnamon and black pepper, along with tobacco notes. It also has Sagrantino's trademark tannic backbone, but the tannins are ripe and are balanced by bright acidity.
Name: Dionigi 2006  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: From the pioneering family that started the Sagrantino revival, this opens with earthy aromas of blue flower, leather and spice, along with whiffs of oak. The palate delivers succulent blackberry, coffee bean, chocolate and black pepper  flavors alongside tightly knit, bracing tannins. Drink after 2016.
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2008 Collepiano  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This structured Sagrantino is loaded with blackberry, spice, leather and balsamic herb sensations. It also demonstrates the grape's massive tannins that will give this wine many more years of staying power. Drink 2016–2026.
Name: Antonelli 2006 Chiusa di Pannone  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This high octane offering opens with aromas of mature black fruit, spice and orange peel. The palate expresses lush black cherry, blackberry and clove uplifted by a note of thyme alongside a seriously tannic backbone. It's shy on fresh acidity and you can definitely detect the alcohol, but it's still delicious.
Name: Di Filippo 2009 Etnico  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This dense dessert wine opens with subtle aromas of black fruit, prune, leather ?and spice. The palate delivers concentrated notes of black­berry, dried cherry, cinnamon and chocolate alongside firm, drying tannins that need a few more years to soften. Sip it on its own as a mediation wine or pair with tarts made with dried fruit. Drink 2016–2028.
Name: Còlpetrone 2008 Passito  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a bold, ripe offering that delivers savory blackberry and black cherry flavors, with layers of white and black pepper. The brawny, tightly-knit tannins are balanced by vibrant acidity, giving this an ageworthy structure. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Bocale 2009  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opulent dessert wine has an alluring fragrance of plum, fig, carob and chocolate. The palate delivers ripe black cherry, prune, raisin and glazed sugar alongside velvety smooth tannins. Perfect to finish the meal with or to sip by the fire.
Name: Antonelli 2007 Passito  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of prune, fig, raisin and espresso. The palate offers ripe blackberry, cherry, and black pepper layered with intense mint, thyme and licorice sensations. It's young but well balanced, with just enough freshness to support the bracing tannins.
Name: Tabarrini 2008 Colle alle Macchie  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with a bouquet recalling blue flowers, berries and white pepper. The palate delivers concentrated dark cherry and blackberry fruits as well as accents of espresso and orange peel. The aggressive tannins, typical of the grape, are balanced by a vein of fresh acidity.
Name: Tabarrini 2009 Colle Grimaldesco  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of oak and espresso. The palate is more interesting, with ripe blackberry and spice in the forefront followed by a warm palate accented with menthol and white pepper notes. It's powerfully structured with noticeable warmth.
Name: Rocca di Fabbri 2008  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fragrances of black fruit and spice lead the nose of this wine, while the palate delivers notes of ripe blackberry, white pepper, and licorice, all accompanied by youthful, aggressive tannins.
Name: Antonelli 2008  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This shows the aggressively tannic structure that makes the Sagrantino grape such a challenge for winemakers. It opens with aromas of black fruit, underbrush and toasted oak. The palate delivers flavors of blackberry, espresso, oak and tobacco leaf alongside brash tannins that will need years to tame.
Name: Lungarotti 2008  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This brawny Umbrian wine opens with aromas of black fruit, coffe bean, espresso and black pepper that carry over to the palate. It's powerfully built with massive yet ripe tannins that still need time to tame. Drink 2016–2026.
Name: Scacciadiavoli 2006  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This brooding wine opens with balsamic aromas of eucalyptus and leather, along with whiffs of freshly turned soil and plum. The palate offers up ripe black cherry, white pepper and the warmth of evident alcohol. It also has massive, astringent tannins. Drink after 2019.
Name: Tabarrini 2009 Colle alle Macchie  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This expression delivers blackberry, black cherry, oak and black pepper notes, along with espresso and mocha accents. It's still tight and aggressively tannic, and will need several years to unwind. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Perticaia 2009  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Description: This rich offering from central Italy opens with a pretty floral fragrance of iris and lilac, along with notes of espresso and toast. The palate is soft and round, with ripe plum, blackberry, coffee, vanilla and a dusting of cocoa.
Name: Cantina Tollo 2009 Riserva Aldiano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this opens with an unusual fragrance of medicinal herbs and ripe black fruit. The palate offers flavors of dense blackberry, raspberry, vanilla and espresso, along with prune and raisin notes.
Name: Di Filippo 2008  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This dessert wine opens with earthy aromas of underbrush and tobacco, with whiffs of chocolate and oak. The palate offers up dense black cherry, blueberry and licorice, along with smooth tannins.
Name: Scacciadiavoli 2006 Passito  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with earthy aromas of wet soil, black fruit and cinnamon-­spice. The palate delivers thick blackberry, blueberry and licorice flavors, with accents of black pepper alongside Sagrantino's calling card of iron-clad tannins.
Name: Tabarrini 2009 Campo alla Cerqua  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a brooding, earthy wine that opens with scents of blue flower, leather, berry and spice. The warm, tight palate delivers ripe black cherry and blackberry flavors accented by licorice, mint and black pepper notes.
Name: Romanelli 2009  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Description: Made from 100% Sagrantino, vinified and aged in steel and concrete tanks, this surprisingly easy-drinking selection offers aromas of black cherry, vanilla, toast, anisette and fennel. The palate delivers flavors of black cherry, blue berry and mineral, with polished tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Antonelli 2009 Contrario Sagrantino (Umbria)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a Sagrantino offering intense balsamic fragrances of menthol and mint that recall Clark's teaberry gum. The palate delivers ripe blackberry, white pepper and cinnamon, along with oak and espresso notes.
Name: Cantina Novelli 2007  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of oak, toast and vanilla. The palate is better, delivering succulent blackberry, licorice, fennel and oak alongside teeth-coating tannins.
Name: Moretti Omero 2009  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with very earthy, almost rustic but not unpleasant aromas of animal, tilled soil, wet wool and leather. The palate delivers ripe—nearly overripe—plum and blackberry flavors accented by sage. The tannins still need time to tame so drink after 2016.
Name: Adanti 2006  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Description: Made from the rare Pugnitello grape, this wine opens with aromas of black fruit and espresso. The palate is one dimensional but offers dense blackberry with hints of spice and licorice alongside polished tannins.
Name: Olivi 2010 Pugnitello (Toscana)

Appellation: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This is rather closed but eventually reveals aromas of oak, coffee bean and espresso. The palate delivers ripe blackberry, licorice and baking spices alongside astringent tannins. It's also a bit shy on fresh acidity.
Name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2009  Sagrantino di Montefalco

Description: Here's an easy drinking wine that opens with aromas of tilled soil and ripe, dark fruit. The palate offers blackberry and plum flavors, with a hint of spice and round, soft tannins.
Name: Tritano 2010  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Made from the Aleatico grape, this opens with intense floral aromas reminiscent of air freshener. The palate offers strawberry, berry and grapefruit flavors that finish slightly off-dry. It's one dimensional, but would would make a fun apéritif.
Name: Gualdo del Re 2012 Shiny Aleatico (Costa Toscana)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This is still closed but reveals restrained dark fruit and cocoa aromas. The palate is also closed down, showing only hints of blackberry and espresso, with massive tannins and evident alcohol. It lacks freshness and seems tired, although it could be in a mute phase. Hold and try after 2016.
Name: Illuminati Dino 2008 Riserva Pieluni  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: This wine opens with aromas of overripe black fruit, coffee, oak and hints of balsamic herbs. The palate, however, is rather tired; most of the fruit has dried up, leaving oak, espresso and alcohol sensations that finish abruptly.
Name: Cantina Tollo 2009 Riserva Cagiòlo  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This is a gorgeous, compelling wine of power and finesse. It has a captivating fragrance of earth, leather, black fruit and incense accented with whiffs of exotic spice. The palate is rich but refined, delivering ripe black cherry, blue berry, tobacco and baking spices along with enveloping, velvety tannins. Drink 2016–2036.
Name: Mastroberardino 2006 Radici Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: Naturalis Historia is a bold and beautiful Taurasi that offers a stunning perfume of violet, incense, berry and leather. The palate has mesmerizing depth, delivering dense black cherry, black pepper, licorice and exotic spice along with notes of well integrated oak. This will continue to develop for years.
Name: Mastroberardino 2006 Naturalis Historia  (Taurasi)

Description: Taurasi is southern Italy's most noble wine, and Pago dei Fusi fits the bill with its combination of structure and elegance. It has an ample fragrance of dark fruit, incense, leather, spice and vanilla. The palate delivers layers of black cherry, tobacco and white pepper along with hints of licorice and espresso balanced by velvety tannins. Drink 2016–2028.
Name: Terredora 2008 Pago dei Fusi  (Taurasi)

Description: This dessert wine from southern Italy is made with the Montepulciano grape and offers aromas of violet and plum. The palate delivers mature blackberry and plum layered with cinnamon, nutmeg and white pepper. It's rich but not sticky sweet and has fresh acidity that leaves a clean finish.
Name: Illuminati Dino 2007 Passito Nico' Montepulciano (Controguerra)

Description: Made from native grape Nero d'Avola, this offers intense aromas of blackberry, pepper and menthol with whiffs of toasted oak. The palate delivers a tight core of sour cherry and blackberry layered with spicy pepper, cinnamon and espresso. It's still young  and wound up so drink after 2015.
Name: Morgante 2010 Don Antonio Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: From one of southern Italy's leading producers, this hearty Aglianico offers earthy aromas of just-turned soil and blackberry. The delicious palate has a ripe core of black cherry accented with white pepper and balsamic notes. It's polished, round and very enjoyable now so drink soon.
Name: Mastroberardino 2011 Aglianico (Campania)

Description: This wine from Campania shows aromas of black fruit, vanilla, espresso and hints of oak. The palate delivers ripe red currant, cherry and blueberry layered with coffee bean, licorice and espresso. The tannins are still astringent and calls out for grilled steaks.
Name: Terredora 2007 Pago dei Fusi  (Taurasi)

Appellation: Monica di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made from native grape Monica, this offers a fruit and spice fragrance. The palate delivers ripe cherry and black pepper with subtle notes of well-integrated  oak. With its smooth texture, fine tannins and fresh acidity, it's a perfect red for grilled fish.
Name: Argiolas 2011 Perdera  (Monica di Sardegna)

Description: Here's a lovely rosé from southern Italy made with native grape Aglianico that boasts pretty floral and fruit aromas of peach blossom and strawberry. The bright palate offers strawberry and raspberry along with mineral and crisp acidity. It has a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Mastroberardino 2012 Lacrimarosa Aglianico (Campania)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from native grape Piedirosso cultivated in volcanic soil near Mt. Vesuvius, this savory wine opens with berry and spice aromas. The palate delivers rich flavors of juicy cherry, raspberry and black pepper along with supple tannins and fresh acidity. Made to be drunk young.
Name: Mastroberardino 2012 Rosso Piedirosso (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Description: Here's a round and approachable Aglianico that shows a softer side to what is southern Italy's most noble grape. This offers delicious blackberry flavors layered with nutmeg and a hint of vanilla along with smooth tannins.
Name: Mastroberardino 2011 Mastro Aglianico (Campania)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a structured red from southern Italy with aromas of red and black berries, forest floor and vanilla. The palate delivers ripe raspberry and black cherry along with white pepper, clove and notes of well integrated oak.
Name: Taverna 2008 Vigna Alta  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: This Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo is a savory rosato from Southern Italy. It has ripe berry aromas along with hints of almond. The palate shows white cherry, strawberry and mineral along with spicy notes of white pepper and cinnamon.
Name: Illuminati Dino 2012 Campirosa  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Description: This delicious rosé from southern Italy shows the charming side to Aglianico, the red grape behind Taurasi. Rosae Novae delivers bright strawberry and sour cherry along with hints of watermelon and peach. It's refined and refreshing.
Name: Terredora 2012 Rosae Novae Aglianico (Irpinia)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from the Piedirosso grape planted along the slopes of Mt. Vesuvius, this has aromas of black currant, espresso and vanilla. The palate is already evolved, but shows red and black fruits along with cocoa. It doesn't have much freshness so drink soon.
Name: Terredora 2009 Rosso Piedirosso (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Vino da Tavola, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Here's an unusual white from Sicily made with red Nero d'Avola grapes. It has a subdued floral fragrance and a linear palate showing citrus notes, white pepper and bracing acidity.
Name: Morgante 2012 Bianco di Morgante Nero d'Avola (Vino da Tavola)

Description: Made from the native Refosco grape, this opens with scents of blueberry, kitchen spice and herbs. The palate is not very expressive but reveals raspberry, red currant and spice tones along with astringent tannins.
Name: Piera Martellozzo 2011 Terre Magre Refosco (Friuli Grave)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with aromas of burned rubber and ripe black fruit. The palate shows dense blackberry extract along with espresso, toasted flavors and very evident alcohol. It finishes on an astringent, drying note of wood.
Name: Morgante 2011 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Riserva Colle Secco, made from the Montepulciano grape, opens with aromas of raw wood chips and sawdust. The palate is dominated by aggressive oak and espresso with hints of black fruit muffled in the background.
Name: Cantina Tollo 2009 Riserva Colle Secco  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Made from the native Aglianico, this rosé sparkler is a sheer delight. It has a lovely fragrance of cherry and hints of nut and baked bread. The refreshing palate delivers additional cherry notes, pastry cream and a hint of walnut.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio NV Dubl Rosé Aglianico (Campania)

Description: This delicious Dolcetto d'Alba has ripe berry and spice aromas. The palate delivers strawberry black pepper and licorice with a hint of almond. Soft and fresh with a silky texture, this is perfect to pair with cured meats or savory pasta dishes.
Name: Massolino 2012  Dolcetto d'Alba

Description: Here's a nice Dolcetto from Dogliani, the grape's spiritual home. It has a classic varietal fragrance of cherry, licorice and black pepper accompanied by smoky notes. The palate delivers black cherry and white pepper along with chewy tannins. Pair this with mushroom risotto.
Name: La Fusina 2011 Gombe  (Dogliani)

Description: Here's a Dolcetto offering sheer drinkability and immediate enjoyment. It has a classic Dolcetto fragrance of black cherry, licorice and black pepper with hints of graphite, all of which carry over to the palate. Fresh and vibrant, this will pair with everything, from pasta to grilled steaks. Saranty Imports, Pleasure Elite.
Name: Mauro Sebaste 2012 Santa Rosalia  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: Made from native grape Colorino, this deeply colored wine offers a spicy fragrance of black pepper and baked plum. The palate delvers ripe blackberry flavors along with white pepper, mint espresso and oak notes. Pair this with seasoned cheeses, salami or grilled steaks.
Name: Piazzano 2011 Colorino (Toscana)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Aged in neutral French oak, it has light notes of herbs, plum, pencil lead and crushed flowers. The acids are tart and racy competing with somewhat gruff tannins. Pair it with pizza or pasta with a red sauce to see it at its best.
Name: Abacela 2010 Estate Grown Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This simple, sparkling dessert wine from Piedmont is made with the red Brachetto grape. It offers a heady fragrance of rose and musk, along with bright strawberry and cranberry flavors. At only 7% alcohol, it's perfect for Sunday brunch.
Name: Castello del Poggio NV Brachetto (Piedmont)

Description: Made from 100% Corvina, this shows the great potential of this native grape. It boasts rich blackberry, plum and licorice flavors, beautifully balanced and velvety smooth. This shows great depth and, while delicious now, hold for a few more years to allow additional complexities to develop.
Name: Allegrini 2009 La Poja Monovitigno Corvina (Veronese)

Description: This is made with 100% Corvina, Veneto's most noble grape. The nose is a bit closed, but offers underbrush, mushroom and ripe blackberry aromas. The palate delivers prune, blackberry and white pepper flavors, with chocolate accents and chewy tannins. While this isn't overly complex, it's delicious.
Name: Zenato 2007 Cresasso Corvina (Veronese)

Description: This single-vineyard wine from Dogliani, the spiritual home of Dolcetto, is made with wild yeasts. It's fragrant and structured, concluding with restrained wild-cherry, spice and mineral notes that come together with flair and finesse.
Name: Pecchenino 2011 Sirì d'Jermu  (Dogliani Superiore)

Description: Made from Dolcetto aged in large Slavonian casks, this Dogliani Superiore is stunning. It's loaded with delicious black-fruit flavors, licorice, white pepper and almond notes, and while it's structured, it's also elegant, with ample depth. This is a connoisseur's Dolcetto.
Name: Pecchenino 2010 Bricco Botti  (Dogliani Superiore)

Description: This lovely Dolcetto is delicious, fresh and utterly drinkable. It has a classic fragrance of strawberry, cherry and licorice, all of which carry over to the palate, along with earthy notes and a hint of almond. Made to be enjoyed young, this pairs perfectly with pasta dishes and pizza.
Name: Pecchenino 2012 San Luigi  (Dogliani)

Description: A bright and silky Dolcetto, this has pretty aromas of berry, licorice and spice. The palate offers vibrant black-cherry, raspberry and anisette flavors, uplifting acidity and mineral notes. Perfect for pasta al pomodoro.
Name: Stroppiana 2012  Dolcetto d'Alba

Description: Here's a straightforward Dolcetto that's loaded with black-fruit and spice aromas. The palate offers black cherry, plum, pepper and licorice. This is simple, but well made and very fresh. Pair it with pasta and tomato sauce or tomato soups.
Name: Castello di Neive 2011 Basarin  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A good effort in a challenging vintage, this opens with pretty fruit flavors of berry and cherry, forward and fresh. Tannins are relatively soft; still the wine seems much less complex than the previous vintage.
Name: Wind Rose 2011 Dolcetto (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A simple but well made Dolcetto, with aromas of black cherry and stewed prunes followed by plum, licorice and graphite on the palate. It closes with a bitter almond note. This would work well with lasagna.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2011 Vigna Ciabot Russ  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: This straightforward Dolcetto offers varietal aromas of black cherry, licorice and hints of black pepper, all of which carry over to the palate. Simple but well made.
Name: Borgogno F.lli Serio e Battista 2012  Dolcetto d'Alba

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: La Folia continues to impress with this young bottling of Dolcetto, its light body and texture tinged with a taste of savory mint, licorice and earth balanced against layers of sweet strawberry. Enjoy throughout spring and summer with antipasto
Name: La Folia Winery 2011 Dolcetto (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is some alchemy at work here, for this unusual Dolcetto—all 24 cases of it—has the complexity of blended wines. Tart pomegranate fruit, streaks of stem and cement, mint and spice, all rise briefly and then fall away. It's a detailed wine, in the enigmatic style that marks this tiny winery as sui generis. Among the lineup of reds from 2010, it's best of show at the moment.
Name: Animale 2010 Dolcetto (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Juicy and floral with dusty tannins, this Lodi blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Sangiovese exhibits the best of both worlds, with a well-integrated taste of soft raspberry jam, cranberry and earth.
Name: Sorelle Winery 2010 Russo Red Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Lodi)

Description: Greg Graziano boldly makes many, many cases of hardly ever seen Dolcetto from Mendocino every year and this one's worth his audacity. Akin to pie a la mode, it has layers of liqueur-like cherry and soft, rounded tannins, an easy drinking wine.
Name: Enotria 2009 Dolcetto (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Small pockets of Aglianico persist in the Foothills with mostly good results. This wine upholds the effort in its boysenberry jam, vanilla and strong tannic structure. Heavy shouldered with a foundation of acidity, pair it with a steaming lamb roast encrusted in herbs.
Name: Montoliva 2008 Aglianico (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As usual, the 2009 Bello Rosso is a 50-50 blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Almost magisterial, this wine is forceful and balanced, and it is packed with black fruits that are matched to the perfectly ripe tannins.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2009 Bello Rosso Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Big, bold and outright luscious, this estate-grown Dolcetto mixes bright flavors of berries and plums with a dusting of cocoa powder and cinnamon spice. A flavor of baking spice wafts through, despite the fact that the wine was kept in neutral cooperage. The finish is long and just a little on the chalky side.
Name: Abacela 2009 Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This roasted and rustically pleasing Montepulciano, which is hard to find in California, has dry tannins, a layer of boysenberry and a leathery mouthfeel. Pair it with roasted chicken or rich risotto.
Name: Bella Piazza 2009 Montepulciano (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Amador Aglianico tastes of intense black cherry and dusty coffee. It exhibits all the qualities of a mature wine, with firm, dry tannins and flavors of black olive and pepper, especially on the finish. Pair it with heavy, meaty dishes cooked with vegetables.
Name: Domenico 2006 Aglianico (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Definitely one of the better Dolcettos to emerge from Washington State, this includes both Barbera and Tempranillo in the blend. Rich, ripe aromas and flavors mix pie cherry and fresh-cut tobacco, with added layers of coffee, licorice and dark chocolate. A feast for the senses.
Name: Wind Rose 2010 Dolcetto (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Half Sangiovese and half Cabernet Sauvignon, the Bello Rosso marries immediate appeal with the structure for some additional years of aging. Boysenberry and vivid black-cherry flavors show excellent definition and penetration, and are highlighted with barrel accents of clove and sweet spices. Over many hours this wine continued to improve and expand.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2008 Bello Rosso Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dolcetto is still a rare sighting in Washington, and the vines that exist are still quite young. Not surprising then that this pleasant red is rather simple, with red fruit flavors and a subtle streak of pepper. The tannins are a little on the stemmy side.
Name: Zerba Cellars 2008 Dolcetto (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A pretty, floral nose introduces this nicely made Dolcetto from southern Oregon. Raspberries abound, with a subtext of light, clean earth. Tannins are modest, the acids natural and subdued.
Name: Melrose 2009 Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a tiny production Charbono that's light and in balance, with flavors and aromas of raspberry, red cherry and mushrooms right out of the dirt.
Name: MICA Cellars 2010 Babcock VIneyard Charbono (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Grown at 2,400-feet elevation from Italian budwood, this Dolcetto, so common to Piedmont but almost unheard of in California, is muy grande, with mountainous tannins and flavors of coffee and toffee and bright notes of cranberry and cherry.
Name: Due Vigne 2007 Musso Family Vineyard Dolcetto (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This alcoholic wine (15.9%, and you can taste it) is also tongue-scrapingly tannic. The black cherry and cassis fruit is fabulous, and quite ripe, but the alcohol starts to burn out the finish. Let the record show that some tasters will love this wine.
Name: Animale 2009 Dolcetto (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Tuolumne County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Mouthpuckeringly tannic at first, this rustic, leathery Montepulciano grown in the hills above Jamestown has a lot of soul, its Italian roots easy to trace and enjoy. Chuck Hovey makes the well-structured, full-bodied wine, a liquid bowl of ripe plums and raspberries, which could stand a bit of bottle age and a gigantic plate of food.
Name: Gianelli 2009 Montepulciano (Tuolumne County)

Appellation: Tuolumne County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gianelli's first attempt with this Italian variety is all that one expects from an Aglianico that is meant to be deep, dark and dense, all chocolate and cherries, tight yet bright. Save it a few years for when you're next having osso bucco.
Name: Gianelli 2009 Aglianico (Tuolumne County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pungent and wild, the grapes for this Montepulciano are grown in the Isabella Francesca Vineyard in Oakley. Winemaker Shauna Rosenblum makes this wine like a Zinfandel, and it is approachable and fairly light, with wild strawberries, black tea and dried herbs throughout and even a slight backdrop of smoke.
Name: Rock Wall 2010 Montepulciano (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Sonoma County's Coturri, an early advocate of organic farming and old-fashioned winemaking, has made a tiny amount of Charbono, a hybrid of Nebbiolo and Grenache. Grown at Testa in Mendocino, a great source of many heritage varieties, including Zinfandel and Carignane, this Charbono is grapey and rustic with a fair amount of acidity throughout.
Name: Coturri Winery 2007 Testa Vineyards Charbono (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Rustic with softened tannins, this Charbono, a rare sight in California where fewer than 100 acres are planted, is inky and mellow, its acidity a good match for a range of goopy, Italian-inspired foods.
Name: Three Rights Left 2008 Charbono (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A grippy, ink-staining, concentrated Charbono from the Santa Clara Valley, made from 90% estate-grown Charbono (the vineyard is in San Martin) and 10% Syrah. Two years spent in French oak might explain its minty, cedar highlights, rounded out by black cherry and plum.
Name: Fortino 2007 Charbono (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: John Chiarito is the first American to petition for the right to label his wine Nero d'Avola, a variety he grows just outside of the town of Ukiah in eastern Mendocino and a nod to his family's Southern Italian heritage (the grape is native to Sicily). Here he's made an outstandingly intriguing, rustic, big fruit, high-acid red that'll surprise you as it opens, very Old World and definitely worth a try if you can find it. Only 60 cases produced.
Name: Chiarito 2007 Estate Bottled Nero d'Avola (Mendocino)

Description: A dark, rich, rustic wine made from Teroldego grapes, a most unusual sight in California, said to be a cousin to Syrah and more often found in Northern Italy. With a lot of black cherry pie, licorice and a hint of smokiness, this wine is most definitely interesting and worth a try and would be stellar with barbecue or pasta.
Name: Montoliva 2007 Teroldego (Clarksburg)

Description: Deep and dark in color, this unusual Lodi bottling of Teroldego, an ancient Italian variety akin to California Zinfandel, is a beast of rich red fruit and chocolate mocha, still robustly tannic and a tad smoky, able to definitely lie down in darkness for several more years.
Name: Peltier 2006 Reserve Teroldego (Lodi)

Description: Clove and pepper spice the dark red cherry aromas on this lovely Montepulciano. Judicious use of French oak makes for a smooth, full-bodied wine with rustic tobacco and smoke notes that highlight the wine's concentrated black fruit and sturdy tannins.
Name: Raffaldini 2007 Montepulciano (Swan Creek)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A rare Washington Dolcetto, this has the expected tart acidity, along with peppery red fruit. Finished with a screwcap, it needs some extra breathing time, and as it opens it shows some pretty raspberry fruit and just a hint of dark chocolate.
Name: Airfield Estates 2008 Dolcetto (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Harvested at 22.6 degrees brix, this bright and spicy Dolcetto does not reach too far. It's tart, with fruit flavors that suggest wild berries and pomegranate, and tannins that are firm but never green. A fine quaffing wine.
Name: Abacela 2008 Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A firm mix of cranberry, stem and pepper; this would be the perfect wine to serve with your Thanksgiving turkey. It's something along the lines of a good Gamay, but with more phenolic bite.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2008 Estate Dolcetto (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Made from the local Rufete grape, this is a prickly, slightly pickled wine. The flavors seem underdeveloped and pithy like pink grapefruit, while the palate feel doesn't really mesh. Too out there to savor a second sip.
Name: Viña Salamanca 2008 Rosado de Lágrima Rufete (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: A subdued and elegant nose of soft strawberry and cherry is followed by mellow fruit flavors with a touch of spice. Though the wine feels a bit past its prime, overall, it has character and an appealing delicate touch.
Name: Vivác Winery 2008 Rosé of Dolcetto (New Mexico)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is Morrison Lane's first Dolcetto—previously these grapes were blended into the winery's Nebbiolo. The color is dark and saturated, the plummy fruit flavors laced with spice and leaf. There is a high acid sharpness on the tongue, with a little green character in the tannins, but it is a very promising first effort.
Name: Morrison Lane 2005 Dolcetto (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Soft aromas of blackberry lead on this sweet “black” dessert wine from New Mexico, but on the palate, its hearty tannins need tempering by rounder fruit. There's a bitter edge to the wine when it should be luscious and sweet. Paired with desserts, it may fare better.
Name: Vivác Winery 2006 Dolcetto (New Mexico)

Description: Spectacular blueberry aromatics enliven this fruit-driven wine. The extraction is right up to the edge of being too much, but sits just perfectly in the mouth. A deep, saturated garnet color with scents of berry and sweet, musky Concord accents. It's solid in the mouth, tannic with a slightly chewy edge to the tannins.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2006 Dolcetto (Washington)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dark and spicy, this lovely, complex Dolcetto emphasizes black fruits, plums and black raspberries. There is a hint of graphite and the suggestion of layered fruit. It's quite acidic, and appropriately so, which makes it best when matched to some richness in the sauce.
Name: Abacela 2005 Dolcetto (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This is wonderfully integrated and complex, offering a dizzying array of spices that blend seamlessly with notes of leather and cherries. Wonderfully velvety in texture and round in the mouth, but also boasting a long, spice-filled finish. A tremendous effort. Drink now–2020.
Name: Masi 1990 Mazzano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Shows more leather and cedar than the Campolongo di Torbe, but even more richness and intensity. Slightly pruny, dried-fruit notes are accompanied by hints of apricot, game and dried spices. Lush and long on the finish; the best of the 2000s. It's approachable, but age-worthy.
Name: Masi 2000 Mazzano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: The bouquet is smoky and meaty in character, without obvious fruit, but waves of cherries and prunes emerge on the palate. This is still richly textured and tannic. Hold.
Name: Masi 1990 Campolongo di Torbe  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Just like fruitcakes themselves, fruitcake notes in wines can be really good or really bad. In this case, it's like one of the best fruitcakes you've ever had, incredibly nuanced and complex with dried fruit and spices that join easily into an integrated whole. Firm on the finish, so age, or serve with hefty main courses or cheeses.
Name: Masi 2000 Campolongo di Torbe  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This is lighter and more elegant than the two crus—a practiced stylistic difference. Cherry blossoms come through here, accented by cinnamon, and showing great intensity without excess weight. Spice and delicate herbal notes mark the long finish. Drink or cellar.
Name: Masi 2000 Serego Alighieri Vaio Armaron  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Delicate cherry and dried spice notes mark the nose of this wine, which is almost delicate relative to Masi's other Amarones. Elegant and complex. Drink now.
Name: Masi 1990 Serego Alighieri Vaio Armaron  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This is Masi's main Amarone bottling, and it's a beauty. Toasted almonds and ripe cherries mark the nose, while the structure of the wine is round and lush without ever seeming overly full or soft. Made in a dry, food-friendly style, with some firm tannins on the finish, this is approachable now, but looks to be capable of aging 5–10 years.
Name: Masi 2001 Costasera  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This is a bit lighter in color than it's younger sibling, the 2000, but still shows no obvious bricking in color. This is nicely supple and softened with age, but still shows plenty of cherry fruit and leather subtleties. Drink or hold.
Name: Masi 1990 Costasera  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
